head_text.subj: FIGURE IN A SANTA CLAUS SUIT

text: lies face-down in a nighttime expanse of snow. One of the body's red-sleeved arms is twisted at a sickening angle. white snow beneath the figure is spreading with red.
The figure in the suit lies motionless. Snowflakes drift.

Dark, rustic wood, an office with broken windows and whis winter beyond. A second BODY in a Santa Claus suit lies d in the doorway. It's a man with a large build. The suit is riddled with h His face is missing.

More snow falling. A handful of cars in the lot. A third  BODY in the same red-and-white outfit lies atop the hood an old Pontiac. His head is not visible, having smashed  through the windshield. His suit is charred and blackened A halo of broken glass outlines him. His black boots hang off the front bumper. The parking lot is silent.
A floor scattered with shiny silver quarters. Reflections neon. There's a fourth SANTA here, face-down in a red poo The suit is far too big for him. Not that it matters now.

where the fifth and final Santa lies at the edge of a rav which plummets a hundred feet down. The man rests precari atop the slope, upside-down, eyes closed. His burned suit is smoldering. He has a sly but tired fac late-20's, sandy hair, cold and scarred. This is RUDY DUN He opens his eyes.
I never was much for the holidays.

head_text.subj: THE SOUND OF A WINTER WIND

text: rises, as a TITLE appears: "SEVEN DAYS BEFORE..." And then, to complete the sentence: "...XMAS."
Snow drifts down onto the stone walls and wire fences of Iron Mountain, Michigan S.I.C. Winter's been here awhile.

Rudy Duncan lies in his top bunk, staring at his ceiling where a handful of paper-cut snowflakes have been pasted. The sounds of YELLING INMATES and GATES slamming shut ech through the fortress. Rudy watches a spider scurry across the paper snow. It's his excitement for the day. He turns to the wall, where there's a photo of his teenag self with some co-workers at an auto body shop. And a fam photo, cheery Midwesterners, with Rudy a scowling Artful  Dodger.

Shows the dates have been crossed off up to December 18th December 22nd is circled again and again. Rudy muses at the calendar, then hops out of his bunk. Dr to the floor, crosses to a desk, finds a chewed-on pen.  Turning back to the beds we reveal --

where Rudy's cellmate, NICK MASON (32), rugged, mustached and well-built, sleeps soundly. In contrast, his bed-wall a COLLAGE OF PHOTOGRAPHS, twenty, maybe thirty of them. A a mural. All of them photos of A BEAUTIFUL YOUNG GIRL, mid-twentie smiling out from beaches, parties and snowy scenes. Gorge brown hair, heartbreaking smile. Effortlessly sexy.
stares at the pictures for a moment, wistful. Nick snores turns over. Rudy climbs atop his bunk again, with the pen this time. And crosses December 18th off the calendar.
The two of them, Nick and Rudy, shivering by the fence. N absently whistles some "Silver Bells," then digs for a sm
What's the first thing, man? What's  the first thing you're gonna do?
Haven't thought about it.
Hell you haven't.
Get to thinking about it, it won't  happen.
We walk outta here, we hit that road,  what's the first thing you're gonna  do.
Ain't there yet.
Three days, man.
Not yet.
Fuckin' Christmas, man. Fuckin,  Christmas on the outs.
Dozens of uniformed INMATES wander the yard, stamping fee hands tucked away, breath frosting. Nick tries to light h cig, but the wind plays havoc. Nick curses, tosses it.
Hot chocolate.
What?
Get a hot mug of chocolate. (nods) First thing I'm gonna do.
(smiles) And a slice of pecan pie, right?
And some pecan pie.
Nick laughs, stares through the fence at the gates of the prison's entrance road. Longingly.
She's gonna be out there, man. Right  there. Right there waiting.
Yeah.
Gonna walk out of this shitstorm and  right into her arms.
Yeah.

Got us a motel out Highway 5, bringing  her own damn sheets, you read that  part? Silk damn sheets. Lock ourselves  in the whole week, drinking wine,  taking baths, man, see if they got  those room service steaks... anything  I want to do. Remember when she wrote  that? Anything I want...
Yeah. Fuckin' Christmas.
Nick grins. They stand there, shivering. It's freezing, b the time they get outside is too precious to give up.
All those pictures she's sent...  y'know... you sure they're all of  her, Nick? You hear sometimes they  don't send their real pictures. Could  be her cousin or something.
Nick studies him.
Why you gotta say a thing like that.
I'm just saying.
Why you gotta. We were gonna give  you a ride someplace, man. Now I  just don't know.
I'm just talking.
Fuck your hot chocolate, Rudy.
They trail off in silence. Nick looks out at the prison r again. A snowy wasteland.
I'm gonna marry this girl.
Rudy lies in his bunk, staring at the same paper snowflak

Hey, hey, listen here. "I've made my  list and I've checked it twice, and  as long as you're naughty, it's gonna  be nice. These cold winter weeks  have been killing me, Nick, as I lie  here alone. It's not enough to have  your warmth in my heart anymore; I  need your warmth next to me. Work at  Penney's has been busy because it's  Christmas and that's when we do almost  half of our business for the whole  year -- ", okay, whatever, whatever -- (skipping on) " -- my manager's still mad at me  for asking for the whole week off,"  whatever, whatever -- (smiles) Here we go. "And all that gets me  through the day is to close my eyes  and imagine holding you, and kissing  you, and touching you, and tasting  you everywhere because I know at  that moment, I'll feel I've found  the reason for my whole entire life."
Rudy still stares at the stone ceiling.
For twenty-five, she sounds pretty  mature.
Yeah. You grow up in Detroit, you  get matured real quick.
Nick's doing pushups on the floor below, smoking a cig,  reading sheets of pink stationery. With a new photo: of t same GIRL, in a bikini by a lake. Vamping a childish pose

Sure as hell don't make me miss Millie  Bobek. Guess I owe Millie, though.  If I hadn't been rollin, her, I woulda  never ended up here. And I woulda  never met Ashley. (studies photo) That's the world for ya.
Nick climbs off the floor, paces back to the bunks, marve at the latest letter.
What if she sees you, man, sees what  you look like... and it's not there.   You just don't do it for her.
Me and her got a connection. (hands page to him) Read this part. Read the part about  stuffing her stocking.
Nick drops the page on his stomach. Rudy sighs, picks it brings it to his nose.
She's using a new perfume.
No, I think that's just oranges. She  writes here she's eating oranges.
Oh.

Shoulda written to that magazine,  Rudy. I'm gonna walk outta here,  walk right into a relationship. Not  some one-nighter, man... a  relationship. You? You're gonna walk  outta here with bus fare. Searching  for the drunkest skirt in the room.
Mornin', gorgeous. More egg nog?
Shoulda written, Rudy...
Nick drops back to his bunk, pasting the new lakeside pho among his collage of pictures. Admiring his pen pal:
Shoulda got yourself a girl.
Above, Rudy peruses the page Nick gave him. Some lipstick marks pressed to the paper. He passes it back, closes his eyes.
All I want... is to make it to Sidnaw,  and sit down for Christmas dinner.  Watch some ball with my old man,  sleep in my old bed, and have  leftovers for bout six months.
Thought you hated Sidnaw.
Just taste that Christmas turkey.
Thought you hate your old man.
Five years, Nicky. Five years. (shrugs) I just want to go home.
There's the echo of CRASHING metal gates. Prisoners YELLI Nick smiles, still staring at his girl.
Well, man. Me and Ashley. We'll be  thinking about you.
GUARDS monitor PRISONERS as they file out of their cells the afternoon meal. Rudy and Nick are motioned out by a M GUARD, his bitter world etched in his face. They join the line.
Shit. Alamo's back.
Across Broadway, a parallel line is forming. A tall, tatt Native American, THE ALAMO, steps out of his cell. His ha are the size of a man's skull.
Don't look like he missed the  sunlight.
Pinscher told me Alamo thinks I'm  the one ratted on him beating up  Cree. Since I was there, I saw it,  he thinks I got him sent to solitary.
Aw, Rudy.
At that moment, Alamo glances over. Finds Rudy's eyes. Ru swiftly looks away --
Count me outta mealtime --
He slaps Nick an the back, heads back for their cell --
GET BACK IN LINE!
I'm not hungry, I'm gonna --
SHOULDA STAYED IN YOUR HOLE! GET  BACK IN FUCKING LINE!

The mean guard pulls his blackjack. Another guard's ready behind him. They want Rudy to give them trouble. Rudy stops. Slides back into the line of prisoners. Looks across Broadway. The Alamo's walked on up ahead. Rudy  swallows, heads toward the mess hall.
A GLOOPY SPOON of CHUNKY RED AND GREEN JELLO gets sploosh on Rudy's plate. Same with Nick. It's the cafeteria line.
What the fuck is this?
Holiday jello.
What's this shit in it?
Swallow and see.
The ugly staffer grins from under his plastic hairnet. Ni looks to Rudy, then turns back to the help:

Just so you know, this man and I are  outta here in two days. So while  we're inhaling London broil and  lobster bisque, you're gonna still  be standing here smelling up the  mystery creamfuck. (nods) Who's in prison now?

The ugly staffer curls his lip. Nick smiles. Rudy moves o taking his tray off the rail and turning -- -- right into the chest of The Alamo. He looks up -- into the most scarred and vengeful face a man could ever dread see. The Alamo's a lifer. Many times over.
When you don't expect it.
It wasn't me, Alamo --
That's when.
The Alamo strides into the cafeteria line. Rudy finally t a breath, as if he's dodged death. Nick's at his shoulder They share a grave and worried look. Trying to help:
Two days.
Rudy and Nick sit at a cafeteria table. Beside Rudy is a  frail, nervous, fiftyish inmate, ZOOK. Zook sits alone, t to no one, always has the shakes.

So maybe after our week beneath the  sheets, we'll head down to Motor  City for New Year's. She says her  roommate's skipping town for a few  days, have the place to ourselves.   Remember how her brother's a truck  driver down there? I'm thinking he  might be able to help get me some  work.
What, working security?
No, I'm through with that shit.  Ashley's right. Gotta start doing  something I got a stake in. Get a  business going.
I don't know, I've seen the business  world.
Hotwiring cars, Rudy, does not qualify  as a small business. Chop shop  consultant; doesn't work on a resume.
Rudy shrugs. He checks across the room, on the whereabout of The Alamo. The big Indian has his back turned.
Ashley's talking about maybe we can  start something up together...
Next to Rudy, Zook has stopped eating. He is still as sto staring at his tray.
Whatsa matter, Zook?
They both watch Zook put down his utensils and reach into his red-and-green jello with his bare hand.
The hell you doing, Zookerman?
Gloppy gelatin drips from his hand, as the frail man lift large black cockroach out. Zook's shaking.
Just a roach, Zook.
Good for you. Protein.
Monsters in the gelatin...
It's a roach, guy --
There are monsters... (voice rising) ...in the gelatin...
Oh, man --
Zook stands up, holding jello aloft:
THERE ARE MONSTERS IN THE GELATIN!
(shakes his head) Fuckin, Zookerman --
THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN!   THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN!
A GRUMBLING MURMUR sweeps through the cafeteria as inmate sift through their jello, searching for --
Sonofabitch!
He pulls something bug-like out of his dessert, holds it  aloft, and then HURLS it at the cafeteria line. A STAFFER ducks away. The inmates LAUGH and suddenly they're all on their feet --
THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN!
-- grabbing handfuls of jello and throwing it at the cafe line. Inmates get errantly SPLASHED, and respond by wheel on their fellow inmates -- red and green globs flying to fro!
SIT DOWN! SIT THE FUCK BACK DOWN!
As GUARDS immediately rush in to restore order --
Rudy, don't move --
Two days, we got two days! Don't do  nothing. Don't touch nothing --
An INMATE at the end of their table picks up their table overturns it, sending food flying. Rudy and Nick stand ba hands raised in surrender. Jello HITS Rudy in the face.
Don't move, Rudy!
Standing right here, man!
Zook is still SHOUTING until a GUARD clubs him senseless  with a blackjack. WHISTLES are blowing. Guards SCREAM for order.
(as a GUARD eyes them) Ate the jello, jello was fine!

The guard leaves them alone, runs on. The melee's still o of control. As Rudy turns -- -- and suddenly sees The Alamo charging across the room,  with murderous eyes, a metal shank in his hand! Five feet away!
RUDY, LOOK OUT!
Nick grabs him, trying to push him out of the way -- -- and The Alamo's shank plunges deep into Nick's stomach burying between his ribs. Blood splashes. Nick slumps.
NICK!

The Alamo pulls the blade out with a ferocious YELL, push Nick to the floor and spins on Rudy! Rudy blocks with a c stumbling back, cartwheeling over a table as The Alamo ro over him for the kill -- -- and two GUARDS tackle the big Indian out of nowhere!  Knocking the knife away, hammering him with blackjacks. I takes another three guards to keep The Alamo down. Rudy scrambles across the floor. Nick's on his back, bloo pumping freely from his gut --
GUARD! GUARD!
(in shock) Alamo...
GUARD!!!
No one's helping, the guards nearby all subduing The Alam Nick grabs Rudy's shirt, gasping to speak --
Jesus, Rudy --
Take it, man! You're all right!   Hold it in! GUARD!
Oh, fuck, Rudy... oh Jesus...
GUARD!!!
Ash... Ashley...
No, man! No, no, no!
(choking) Tell her... I'll be there ...
You're GONNA be there! We're getting  outta here! TAKE IT!
Tell Ashley... I...
YOU TELL HER!
...be with her...
Blood spills out Nick's mouth. His eyes go vacant.
NO!!!
...for Christmas...
NICK!!!
And Rudy's suddenly hauled backwards. A trio of GUARDS  descend, grabbing Nick's body as his life fades away. Dra his figure out of the melee. WHISTLES are blowing.
GET HIM OUT OF HERE! LOCK DOWN!
NICK!!!
Rudy struggles, enraged, and gets blackjacked across the  skull for his trouble. He hits the jello-covered floor. And the world goes dark.

Darkness and shadows. Rudy sits in a corner, holding his  head. The cell block silent for the first time. Bootsteps from down the row. A SHADOW falls across Rudy's somber figure. It's the Mean Guard. He stares at Rudy wit distinct pleasure.
The man had two days...
Well. Least he won't be coming back.
The guard grins a gold tooth. Rudy looks at him -- -- and then springs to his feet, charges the room, grabbi through the bars. The guard takes a calm step back. Keeps the cruel smile.
You need company tonight, Rudy...  you just give a holler.
He puckers a kiss and walks on. Starts whistling "Are You Lonesome Tonight?" Several shadowed VOICES request that h shut the fuck up. The bootsteps and melody drift down the row.
turns back, starts toward his bunk. And stops. His eyes o Nick's empty bed. And the wall behind.
Smiling, laughing, playing kissy-face. Hearts drawn on th photos. All colors of stationery taped to the wall.

takes a seat on Nick's bed. There's a shoebox at the foot it. Rudy opens it. It's filled with Ashley's letters. He trails a finger along them, must be over a hundred pag He selects the one nearest the front. Surveys it.

Rudy, man, here we go, here, what  she wrote here: "The car's waiting.  The motel's waiting. And I'm waiting.   I've waited for so long. I'm burning  for you, Nick. My whole body. My  whole heart. I'm burning for you..."
Rudy turns to the wall. To the lakeside picture of Ashley swimsuit siren. Rudy stares sadly.
He was burning for you too...
And puts the letter away.
As his hand slashes through December 21st. Prison's over.
Snow swirls. Near blizzard conditions. A heavy steel door BANGS open, held by an EXIT GUARD. And FIFTEEN CONVICTS,  make that EX-CONVICTS, trudge onto a fenced drive, covere in snow.
Your world and welcome to it,  dumbfucks! Don't be a stranger now!  We'll keep the lights on for ya!

Rudy stumbles out with the group, shivering in a Goodwill hand-me-down coat. Thin canvas, wouldn't keep him warm in summer. Secondhand shoes. No possessions. He clutches his sides with his hands, hunched over. All  fifteen huddle and herd toward the gate at the end of the fenceway.

There are a dozen FRIENDS and RELATIVES waiting. A few ME several WOMEN, a couple KIDS. Bundled in winter coats, ha and hoods. A prison shuttle bus is parked behind them. The released cons reach the gate, where a GATE GUARD unlo the fence to the outside world. Fifteen men are free. The ex-cons and relatives scan each other's faces. Wives  rush over to embrace their men. Pals nod to ex-cons and t slaps on backs. Reunion time. The snow batters them, wind whipping. Rudy keeps his head down, leaning forward, keeps walking. Toward the bus. But can't help himself -- he glances up --
bundled in a silver ski jacket, pink wool hat with a poof on top, scarf and mittens. Scanning the released prisoner
drops his head, looks away. Climbs onto the shuttle bus.

Rudy shakes his arms, basking in the vehicle's warmth. Ta a seat at the back. A couple other lone ex-cons climb abo Then the cons with relatives start to pile in. Rudy's window is steamed against the cold. He stares into his lap, then reaches for his coat pocket. Takes out the  picture of Ashley, in her bikini by the lake. Stares at i He rubs his window with his sleeve. Outside, the woman in the silver coat turns this way and  that, troubled. She's watching the other ex-cons climbing onto the bus with their loved ones. The woman looks back to the prison. The guard closing the gate. The steel door has been shut. No one else is coming Rudy watches her sadly. Aboard the bus, the seats fill up. Ex-cons are feeling up their wives, kids are climbing on their absent daddies,  buddies are jawing loudly 'bout how the neighborhood's  changed. The woman outside is now alone. Silver coat, pink poofbal Rudy looks at the bikini picture again. Then at the shivering bundle.
Don't do it, Rudy...

The bus ENGINE starts up. In the seat beside Rudy, an EX- makes out with his WIFE while his bratty KID punches his  leg. Out the window, the young woman is scanning the bus windo Then the prison again. She turns in a worried circle. Rud looks swiftly away. Closes his eyes.
Don't do it ...
The bus door closes. It REVS and starts forward. Rudy sig with relief. The photo of Ashley falls to the floor.

The young woman watches the bus pull away, down the snowy road. But it doesn't get fifty feet before it suddenly st The door opens. And Rudy steps out. The bus REVS up again and GROANS OFF into the winter. The young woman pushes her poofball hat out of her eyes. get a look at her face for the first time. Skin pale, lip turning blue, but it's the girl from the pictures. It's  Ashley. She watches Rudy's figure trudge back toward her. Snow  obscuring him until he's right in front of her. Both of t shivering. Both of them standing there. And finally:
You Ashley?
Ashley nods. And Rudy sadly smiles.
I'm Nick.
Rudy and Ashley sit at a coffee shop booth. Coats still o Big rigs bluster by on the highway outside. Two untouched cups of coffee sit before them. She's watching him in silence.
I like your coat.
Ashley says nothing. Rudy looks at his own:
This -- this is just something they  gave me at the door. Wasn't snowing  when we signed up, y'know?
Ashley nods.
How's your coffee?
Ashley looks at it, like she's just realizing it's there. She lifts the cup, takes a sip. Puts it down.
Good.
Rudy nods. Silence again.
Gotta be ten degrees out there.
Radio said negative five.
Negative five?
Yeah.
I don't think it's negative five.
Radio said.
Beat.
Wind chill. That's probably what  they meant.
Ashley nods. Rudy bites his lip.

I was scared. Scared you were gonna  take one look at me and change your  mind. Scared I was walking into  heartache. All those words... you  put a picture in your mind of where  they come from and when you see where  maybe it's not the same as your  picture.
He trails off.
I figured you walked outta there and  saw me and walked right the other  way --
No, no --
Saw my outfit or something, my coat --
No, hey, I like your coat --
Saw me --
Ashley, no. That was me, that's what  I was scared of. I mean, be serious...   I ain't exactly looking like Mr.   Universe here.
You are to me.
Rudy goes silent. Whoa. Ashley considers.
Thought you wrote you had a mustache.
I can get another one going. Y'know,  hey, whatever you want me to --
No, no, no. Be like you want to be.
Another awkward pause. Rudy picks up a milk dispenser bes the coffee, puts it to his lips. It gives him a wide whit mustache. He stares straight-faced. Ashley gives a bashful smile, covers it.
Do that again.
What.
Smile.
Ashley smiles again, blushing now.
No --
One more. Smile. One more.
(trying not to) No, c'mon --
I've been dreaming about that smile,  Ashley Mercer. For a long time.
They stare across the table, drifting into one another's  eyes.
You're better than the picture in my  mind, Nick... (softly) You're real.
Outside, another truck rumbles by, whipping up snow.

And Rudy and Ashley SLAM inside, kissing passionately, li intertwined, pawing at each other's coats. Rudy kicks the door closed. Mouths devouring, hands lost in snowy hair. They collide with a side table, knocking over a lamp, tum onto the lumpy bed. Rudy tears at her silver coat and swe and turtleneck and capilene and whatever else's she got o as Ashley's lips explore his neck and body. Writhing and  wrestling and rolling off the bed. Bang.
Rudy and Ashley fuck like lovers in R-rated movies.
The bed sheets lie tangled on the floor. Rudy and Ashley  rest naked amidst them. Her pretty young head on his ches all their inhibitions gone. Rudy strokes her arms.
Tell me something. This the first  time you've ever done this?
Go to hell, Nick Mason, what's that  supposed to mean --
No, not that, no... (laughs, kisses her) I mean this, the whole thing. Start  writing to a guy, guy in the bricks.  Get a boyfriend like this. Tell me  the truth.
Well. You're not the first guy I  wrote to. But you're the only one I  kept writing to.
Yeah. Me too. (considers) Why? I mean I know why for me, why I  paid for the ad. But you... why start  writing to some guy -- some con --  you don't even know?
Ashley studies his face, smiles in reflection.
I told you, Nick. Remember?
Tell me again.

All the guys I've ever been with...  they never want to know me. Who I am  on the inside. They just want to qet  inside. When they do, they think  that means they know who I am. That  I trust them. That they know me.  That there's nothing left to learn. (beat) A guy like you, Nick -- six months  before you can even touch my face. I  figure a guy in that kind of bind,  he's gonna hafta work to get to know  me some other way.
Had some bad relationships, didn't  you.
Not bad. Just regular. (smiles) You wrote me wonderful things, Nick.   Personal things.
She turns to him, kisses his chest --
Well, wasn't all me, y'know.
Yes it was all you --
Guy I was in with... he helped  sometimes... some of the romantic  stuff, actually... you'd like him --
I'm talking about the heart, Nick.  I'm not talking about the words.
Y'know, some of the heart mighta  been his too...
Then he shoulda signed his name.
She turns over playfully, eases herself back atop him. Re to make up for lost time. With a kiss:
And he'd be here right now.
Ashley runs through an Xmas-decorated megamall, dragging  Rudy behind her. Both of them laughing, as she hauls him  over to some cookie bakery company:
Where the hell are you going?
Provisions! We are not leaving that  motel room again till after New  Year's: we need ten days worth of  provisions! (to cookie matron) What's good?!
Oh my, we've got a special on our  chocolate crunchie elves, they're  shaped like little helpers --
THIS MAN... has not had a cookie in  two goddamn years! Get him two of  everything!
Ashley, Jesus --
Can't survive on our bodies alone,  Nick. (to cookie matron) Hurry up!
Ash... didn't you write me that you  don't eat chocolate?
Yeah, well you wrote me you were six- foot-four, baby. (teasing smile) So don't talk to me about little  white lies.
Teddy bears with nightcaps, green bows, red ribbons. Ashl tearing through men's clothing racks, all love and confid Rudy's got a bunch of purchase bags weighing him down:
You need a COAT!
Ash, you've gotten me enough --
No boyfriend of mine is going to  walk around in negative-five degree  wind chill without a goddamn good- looking coat!
She pulls out a hellacious black leather fringe number.
Baby, c'mon, all this stuff... I  haven't gotten you anything --
You got out, Nick. You're here.   You're my Christmas.
She puts the jacket against his chest, smiling. Rudy sigh
It's two hundred dollars, Ash --
She whips a Penney's card from her purse, grins wickedly:
You forget where I work?
(beat) Beauty and fragrances.
Fifty percent off, motherfucker. Ho  ho ho.
She runs off with the jacket. Rudy turns to a dressing mi left to stare at his reflection. An ex-con in rags, with half-dozen holiday shopping bags. To himself:
Just for the holidays, Nick. Then  we'll tell her. We'll let her...  have her holidays...
Rudy nods till he convinces himself. Can't help but smile
Puzzles, Barbies and dinosaurs. KIDS scurrying, PARENTS  chasing. Rudy and Ashley with a scared TEEN CLERK:
You can't find... what?
Toys for adults. Where are your toys  for adults?
Toys for... adults?
C'mon. How old are you, sixteen?  C'mon.
We sell children's toys --
(slams money down) I got fifty dollars to spend in your  store, Jesus of Nazareth. Can you  help me or not?
The clerk glances around, then, low:
Slinky's in aisle five, Twister's in  aisle one, Moon Mud's in aisle four.
Thank you.
As bottles of wine, vodka and rum, cartons of egg nog and orange juice, and countless prepackaged sandwiches come  scrolling past.

You know what I was thinking, after  our holiday hideaway? Instead of  going back to Detroit, maybe we could  go gambling. Y'know? Drive up to  that Indian place you worked at.  Wouldn't that be fun? I haven't gone  gambling in forever!
Light snow falls. Rudy, in his new black fringe eyesore, Ashley carry grocery bags across the icy asphalt:
Well, I don't know about that --
Blackjack, Nick, blackjack I am good  at. I mean, they'd give us some free  games or something, wouldn't they?  Since you worked there?
Security, Ash, I just worked security.   They wouldn't be rolling out the red  carpet --
And the slots, slots I'm good at  too. Wouldn't that be fun?
We'll have more fun in Detroit.
We could live it up and --
Ashley. We're not going anywhere I  used to work.
It comes out too harsh. Ashley stops, a little hurt.
I just... I thought you'd have friends  there...
Rudy softens, touches her arms:
Hey. I been in prison for two years,  Ash. Believe me. Those guys wouldn't  want to see me.
He kisses her. She nods, dismisses it, kisses back.
Well, they don't know what the hell  they're missing.
Ashley's Chevy Nova pulls back into the lot of the roadsi joint. There's an artificial (silver) Christmas tree tied the roof. She and Rudy climb out; she heads for the office:
Baby, I'm gonna go tell 'em not to  disturb us for the rest of the year.  I get back in that room, you better  be wearing nothing but a candy cane.
I'll see what I can do.
No, lover. I'll see what you can do.
She smiles, sashays sexily away. Rudy watches her go, adm his good fortune. Then pops the trunk, collects some of t shopping score. Gifts and goodies.
(sings, sotto) I have no gifts to bring, parum-pum- pum-pum. No treasures for the king,  pa-rum-pum-pum-pum...

Rudy watches the good ol' boys stumble toward the hotel. turns back, surveys his new prison cell
They've never done a robbery... (nods) Christmas is looking up.

The bed has been dragged to the door to the bathroom, the comforter and pillow are on the floor, "Miracle on 34th S is on the TV, and Rudy lies asleep on the ground, ankle s cuffed. Two SHADOWS fall across him.
Rudy is brusquely dragged out by Jumpy and Merlin, passin Ashley, who lies asleep in the hall, head on a pillow.
Having romance problems, Romeo?
Not with you.
They march him onward. Rudy glances over his shoulder at  Ashley. Who spent the night at his door.
A wood-panelled room adjacent to a small indoor pool, wit arcade games and a dart board. Gabriel's with Pug, tossin darts, as Jumpy and a chain-smoking Merlin haul Rudy in.
Goddamn, Merlin. There any part of  the day you don't smoke?
There anytime you don't got a mouthful  of shit?
Cancer-sucker.
Acid-chewer.
Gabriel THWAPS a dart into the board, to shut them up.
Take a look what Pug's bought for  ya.
Pug empties a shopping bag on a pinball machine. Cowboy b spurs, a black cowboy hat, a black rhinestone jacket and longhaired wig tumbles out.
A cowboy. You're going to send me  into an Indian casino disguised as a  cowboy. Have you thought this entirely  through?
Put it on.
Merlin and Jumpy shove Rudy toward the merchandise. Gabri slams another dart into the board, then turns:

You're a country-western singer up  from Nashville for the the holidays.  Visiting your Grandma on the lake,  driving into the Tomahawk for some  scotch and slots. You only play the  slots, you got that? Don't want no  dealer friend of yours recognizing  you, you sidle up to shoot some craps.
What kind of half-ass cowboy plays  the slots?
You do.
At least gimme video poker.

Shut the fuck up. You play what your  girlfriend plays. Ashley's going in  with you. You talk to her, otherwise  you don't talk to nobody. You walk  the room as many times as you want,  but the second you come out, I want  to know the run of the place.
Rudy examines his new hair and cowboy gear.
Do I get a country-western name?
You get recognized, convict, You get  a country-western funeral.
The Chevy Nova crunches into the parking lot in the shado of the gaudy neon axe.
Rudy's in "disguise": paste-on goatee, tinted shades and  black cowboy gear. Very Nashville Network. He's wedged between Jumpy and Merlin, wearing handcuffs.  Gabriel, Ashley and Pug in the back.

Y'know what, guys? I woke up this  morning, I got a really lucky feeling  going on. I mean it, I'm feeling  that good. I wouldn't be surprised  if I walk in there, pull a handle  and hit jackpot. Hell, we wouldn't  even have to --
Get out.
Rudy stamps feet, shivering in the cold, as Merlin unlock his cuffs. Gabriel reaches to help Ashley out --
Get your goddamn hands off me --
She edges toward Rudy, then stops. A chill still there.
You got one hour.
I'm gonna need some money.
Gabriel hands a bill.
Ten dollars? What do I do with ten  dollars?
Don't tip.

Monster. If we're working together  here, we gotta be working together.  I can't walk in there looking like  the Lone Fucking Ranger with ten  bucks to throw down. You don't want  me getting noticed, right? Not getting  noticed costs a guy at least a couple  hundred.

Gabriel glares, turns to his crew. Mutters, rubs his fing together. Merlin, Pug and Jumpy reach for their wallets,  grumbling. Gabriel takes a few twenties from each. Rudy nods thanks as Gabriel hands him the cash --
(threateningly) Don't. Lose.
Rudy pockets the wad, hooks his elbow for Ashley to slip arm through. Grins with a drawl:
You ready to gamble, darlin'?
She regards him warily, but puts her arm in his.
(to the boys) Y'all take care of my guitar.
He tips his hat, and strides for the casino entrance. Gab and his truckers watch them go.
(grumbles) Who's robbin' who here, Gabriel...
Get in there and watch 'em. Watch  their every fuckin' move.

The cascade of JINGLING and JANGLING COINS fills the brig lit, horrendously-carpeted space. Wooden-beamed ceilings  suggest a rustic theme, but the neon slots, lush green ta and red wheels of fortune are pure Midwest Vegas. The Tomahawk is tiny by Nevada standards, about the size a large bingo hall. This morning, about FIFTY GAMBLERS mi about. Skimpily-dressed COCKTAIL WAITRESSES, most of them Powaha Indians, pimp drinks. Bored DEALERS deal. As the sound of slot machine payoffs suddenly go silent -

And some scattered cassettes, labeled "Big Winners," "Lit Winners," and "Medium Cash." A HAND pops the tape current in the system -- "Big, BIG Winners" and flips it over. Pr play. The sounds of JINGLING and JANGLING return.

An office overlooking the casino floor through smoked gla JACK BANGS, late 50's, silver-hair, capped teeth, shark s and high blood pressure, paces his office. He's got the a of a washed-up gameshow host, Wink Martindale, Peter  Tommarkin, one of those hacks. Right now he's all caffein

There's an S-word I'd really like to  throw in the discussion here, guys,  cause it's a big part of what's going  on. Big element, 'kay? S-word. It's  a serious issue, serious factor, so  I'm just gonna get it out there,  throw it an out there, so we can  know it, we can talk about it, we  can get things done... (big pause) Snow. Are you with me, guys? Snow.  Big time, fucking, grade-A, God- quality, S-N-O-W-snow.
Two INDIAN GOVERNORS sit before him. Business-dressed, wi overcoats, ponytails. One gray-haired, one jet-black.

There's no snow in Vegas, 'kay? They  don't know it, they don't want it,  they got laws against the stuff.  They got Egypt down there, right,  they got Monte Carlo, Hawaii, they  got ancient Rome, but where's the  Winter Castle, right? Where's the  Swiss miss Chalet? Where's the Big  Fucking Igloo?
We understand you, Mr. Bangs.
Capades? They don't do it. Mittens?   Outlawed. Why?
We're aware of your position.

(picks up a chip) Because down there this is money.   Up here this is heat. (pleads) You wanted Vegas quality, I brought  it to you. You wanted Vegas press, I  gave it to you. But guys, please,  guys... I can't get you Vegas  profits... till one of ya does some  spirit dance and does something about  this snow.
The tribal governors stare him down.
We understand the Paiutes' casino  saw a net profit of twelve million  dollars last year.
The Paiutes, they cook their books.
The Waitela reservation made seventeen  million.
(sobers) Seventeen?
Perhaps you have researched this,  Mr. Bangs. Is the snowfall on our  side of the lake that much greater  than the snowfall on theirs?
Jack Bangs stares at them both. Considers his next move -
I'm bringing in this great showroom  act next week; these three Russian  girls, they look like Meryl Streep,  they can juggle anything.
Mr. Bangs.
Guys. We're doing it right, here.  $5.99 prime rib? Nobody does that in  Michigan. Nobody.
The tribe is concerned that many of  your... new ideas are not resulting  in any new venues.

I'm putting liquor in the drinks,  I'm giving 10-times odds on craps, I  got the girls showing sixteen-percent  more skin! Show me another buffet's  gonna offer you Coke and Pepsi!  Whaddya want me to do?!
We want to see our casino making  money again, Mr. Bangs. Making money  for our community.
Like the Paiutes and the Waitela.
The young man stands, stares Jack Bangs in the eye.
We want you doing the job... that we  brought you here to do.
Rudy and Ashley move away from a change booth, with a buc of quarters. Rudy messes with his cowboy getup, noting tw SECURITY GUARDS punch a code in a private door, step insi
So does it look a lot different?
Here and there. Restaurant, uh, that's  the main expansion. Tables've been  moved around; the big man's office,  I dunno, might be upstairs now.
They settle at a slot machine. Another SECURITY GUARD wal past them. Rudy turns his back. Ashley notices.
That guy knows you?
Yeah, uh. Mike. That's Mike.
At the door, Merlin and Jumpy enter, wandering through th slots. Rudy sees them.
You start spending your brother's  money. I'm gonna take a circuit around  the joint, check for any new ins and  outs. I'll snag us some drinks.
As he strides away --
(sotto) Be careful, Nick...

with Rudy, ambling among the tables, making a show of che out the layout. In reality, he's surveying the GAMBLERS. Passing the cage, he walks right by Jack Bangs and the In governors. Jack Bangs is all smiles, while the governors  turn their backs an him and storm out.
Couple rum and Cokes, please.
You want that rum and Coke or rum  and Pepsi?
Rudy gives him a strange look. The bartender shrugs. Rudy still scans the tables, settling on --
where a trio of COLLEGE KIDS are forking over chips. One them's dark-haired with a goatee, a sweatshirt and jeans. Rudy studies this kid for moment.
Gimme a goddamn bottle of anything.
Jack Bangs sidles up, distraught. The barkeep hands him a bottle. Bangs takes a swig.
I can't go back to Vegas, Bear.  They'll fuckin' kill me, 'kay? I  can't go back...
What does the tribe want?

They want gold-paved roads is what  they want. Talking 'bout the fuckin'  Paiutes. Fuckin' Paiutes are on the  interstate. Nothing I can do about  that, man, I didn't pick the spot  for your reservation.
Neither did we.
Yeah, yeah, whatever.
Rudy gets his drinks, as Jack Bangs turns his way:
Hey. Hey, cowboy. Jack Bangs, I run  the place. Nice to have you in the  Tomahawk. Tell me something...
Rudy winces, glancing to see Merlin and Jumpy watching hi Frowns on their faces.
...does upstate Michigan need another  roadside casino or does upstate  Michigan need an international gaming  destination?
(wants outta here) Roadside casino?
Jack Bangs, smile falls flat.
Well, so how'd you hear about this  place, then. Word-of-mouth? Mass  mailings? Cable TV?
Prison.
Prison?!
Rudy shrugs, smiles, takes off with his drinks. Bangs loo sick, turns to a FAT GUY on the next stool over. But befo he can ask, the guy shakes his head --
I just stopped in to use the can.
Bangs turns to the bartender, puts his head in his hands:
I can't go back to Vegas, Bear... I  can't...
From the slots, we hear a JACKPOT PAYOFF.
Aw fuck.
walks Rudy, as Merlin sidles up next to him:
What the hell was that about --
He didn't recognize me. Back off,  willya? He didn't recognize me.
Merlin eyes him darkly, but lets him walk on into the slo As he nears Ashley, he glances to the blackjack table, wh the College Kid has left... heading for the bathroom --
Hey Nick! We're up fifty cents!
-- and as a barely-dressed COCKTAIL WAITRESS crosses betw Rudy and Ashley, blocking her view of him -- Rudy pretends to crash into her, splashing the rum and Co into his own face --
Heyyyy!
Reaching Ashley, his goatee is dripping --
Nick, what happened --

There went my... damn... well, doesn't  seem like security's all that  switched... Ash, shit, this mustache  is starting to fall off. I gotta fix  this thing -- (hands her his glass) -- drink this for me.
He hustles for the bathroom. A moment later, Jumpy storms by. Stops at Ashley.
What happened?
He started losing his hair.
The College Kid is zipping up when Rudy SLAMS into his ba money in hand, crashing him against the wall:
Hundred bucks to wear this jacket --
Jesus, man, don't kill me!
Nobody's killing you, kid. Santa's  giving you a rhinestone jacket and a  hundred bucks.
Merlin's at a slot machine, watching the hall to the  bathrooms. A WAITRESS arrives, hands him a beer:
Thanks, sister. How are ya.
Fuckin' freezing.
Hell yeah. You work here long?
Five years. Since it opened.
How long ago was your makeover?
My what?!
No, the place. The remodeling. moving  everything around.
The waitress frowns.
The Tomahawk's looked the same since  I started, mister. (shrugs) Only the losers change.
Merlin stares at her. Then drops his drink to the floor,  charging for the bathroom.

As Merlin crashes in, seeing the cowboy hat and jacket, b turned, adjusting a belt. As the figure turns around. It's the College Kid. Merlin stops in his tracks -- -- as Rudy CRASHES into him from a stall, kicking his leg out, driving his throat into a countertop. Merlin hits th ground, gagging. Rudy wears the kid's sweatshirt:
GO! GO!
The College Kid, shaking, hustles out the door.

As the College Kid, in Rudy's black getup, strides out of the bathroom hall, walking for the casino exit. From the slots, Ashley and Jumpy glance up, seeing him go From their vantage, it looks like Rudy. They frown. As they're watching the Kid hit the door, Rudy darts out the hall, heads the other way.
Gabriel and Pug sit sentry, seeing the cowboy figure leav the casino. wandering into-the parking lot... away from t
Where the hell's he going?
Where the hell's your sister?
As the figure unlocks the driver's door of a Trans Am --
Get him!
Pug REVS the engine, speeds through the lot, cutting off Trans Am from backing away. Gabriel jumps out, HAULS the cowboy from his car and sees it's the College Kid. Rudy's gone.
(scared shitless) Oh man. It's your jacket, isn't it...
Merlin stumbles out of the bathroom, holding his throat.  Catches Jumpy and Ashley's eyes from the slots:
Trouble.
As Rudy charges toward COOKS, holding a buffet plate alof
MEDIUM RARE?! You call this MEDIUM  RARE??!!
-- hands them the plate, hurries past them, and out the -
-- to the back of the building. In his stolen clothes, he charges across the staff parking area and into the snowy  expanse of meadow beyond. Running for a thicket of winter woods.
Merlin and Jumpy stride out to join Gabriel and Pug. Ashl follows, stumbling to keep up.
Where the HELL did he go?
Monster. There never was a structure  change. This place was built the  same from day one.
That motherfucker --
And Monster... he was talking with  the casino manager. Nick was talking  to him.
Gabriel darkens.
Get. Him. Back.
Rudy races as best he can through the waves of snow. He k struggling, losing his footing, fighting his way toward t cover of trees. From far away...
Nick! Run! RUN!!!
Rudy turns back to see Merlin, Jumpy and Pug round into v back at the parking lot. They see him. And charge into the snowfield. Rudy breaks into the trees.
Gabriel pushes Ashley into the Nova and peals out of the  parking lot. Onto reservation roads.

Rudy darts among barren oaks and brush pines, crunching d into snowdrifts, slowing him down. Stumbling forward,  shivering, breath frosting -- -- as Merlin, Jumpy and Pug reach the treeline. Gaining b struggling too. With guns held. Rudy keeps battling through the drifts -- -- as GUNSHOTS start to ring out. Rudy glances back to re the truckers are a hundred yards distant. But as he turns struggle on, treebark SPLITS apart beside him. Rudy keeps running.
Bouncing over a snowy dirt road, having found a shortcut  into the woods. Gabriel searches the trees, Ashley too.
Merlin, Jumpy and Pug keep up their steady march. Rudy's  running figure now only fifty yards distant.
You keep running, Nick! Keep running  now! Can't keep warm if you don't  keep running! We'll just be right  back here... keeping track of your  trail.
ANGLE to show Merlin's striding right in Rudy's bootprint Pug FIRES off two shots. They KICK UP snow just behind Rudy, struggling, panting..
Wherever you run... we'll get there.  Fast as you want... we'll be there.   We drive for a living, Nick. Twelve,  fifteen, twenty-hour days.
Rudy's anguished, ducking behind some pines, trying to br away his footprints. Realizes it's useless. A BULLET whistles through the pine branches.
We got nothing but time.

Rudy takes a breath, crashes onward -- -- then stops at the sound of a RUMBLING. Getting louder. Closer. It's a car's engine. Rudy spins for the source, focuses, and manages to make o a snow-covered dirt road fifty yards away, down a swale.  Another BULLET smashes treebark. Rudy runs for it.

As Rudy leaps out to wave down the car, as around the cor comes a Chevy Nova -- -- with Gabriel and Ashley inside. Gabriel's eyes widen, floors the gas, RACING right for Rudy. Rudy scampers toward the opposite roadside, a steep woode slope cradling a meadow and frozen river --
No!!!

-- as Ashley grabs Gabriel's steering wheel, swerving the other way. Gabriel fights her for control -- -- as the Nova just misses Rudy, who dives off the road,  hits the slope and tumbles head-over-heels toward its bot a hundred feet down, kicking up geysers of snow! On the road, the Nova skids to a stop. Ashley and Gabriel leap out, as Merlin, Jumpy and Pug reach the road.
Rudy pops to his feet, a dazed snowball.
Gabriel grabs a rifle from the Nova, steps to the slope-t edge and takes aim --
RUN!!!
-- as Ashley suddenly slams into him from behind -- Sending the both of them tumbling down the slope! Sliding and tangled, the rifle flying from Gabriel's grasp --
-- where they come to a tangled, snowy halt. Gabriel stru to clear the ice from his face -- -- as the butt of his rifle cracks him in the jaw.
That's for reading her mail.
He extends a hand to Ashley --
Come on.

-- and hauls her to her feet. Ashley beams. As Gabriel ho the two of them scramble away from the woods, Rudy with t rifle, toward the meadow and its frozen pond. More GUNSHOTS ring as Merlin, Jumpy and Pug slide their w down the ravine.
Rudy and Ashley race out across the ice. The traction's  slippery, but there's no way around. There's a highway br two hundred yards away, with sparse truck traffic.
We get to the bridge, we're all right!
Nick, the ice is --
Get to the bridge! (waving at traffic) HEY! HEY! DOWN HERE!

He grips her hand tighter, as SHOTS crash into the ice at their feet. Suddenly, the ground splinters and gives way -- and Ashley goes plummeting through to the river! She  vanishes from sight in an instant! Rudy scrambles back, onto sturdy ice. He stares, stunned, the ripples in the freezing water. Ashley's not coming up.
Looks to the truckers in pursuit. Coming down the ridge. Then the highway. Safety within sight. But he can't run. Cursing himself, he grips the rifle tig and LEAPS into the ice-hole --

-- plummeting underwater, the temperature hitting his bod like needles. He writhes, spinning around -- -- and sees Ashley ten yards away, desperately pounding a the ice above her. Strength giving out. Rudy struggles to her, wrapping an arm around her. She fi panicked, clawing at the ice, both of them pulled further away from the opening. With Ashley safely in hand, Rudy raises his rifle-arm,  pressing the barrel against the ice above them -- -- and FIRES. A HOLE blasts a shaft of light into the gra blue. Rudy FIRES again. Another HOLE caves in. Ashley rea for a sheath of ice, splashing --
-- clutching frozen ground, treading water. Rudy surfaces beside her, the both of them gasping, facing the bridge. Instinctively, they spin around --

head_text.subj: TO FIND GABRIEL, MERLIN, JUMPY AND PUG

text: -- standing right behind them. Guns trained.
(rubs his jaw) At the rate you're going, Nick...   I'm gonna have a hard time ever  considering you family.
He extends his hand, a gesture of help. But menacing.
How lucky ya feeling now.
Pitch black. We can barely make out a huddled, fetal form quaking and trembling. It's Rudy. Dripping wet, on the ve of hypothermia. Trying to stay conscious:
I-I-I-I have n-n-no g-g-gifts to br- br-bring, pa rum-p-p-p-p-p (struggling) ...pum-pum-pum. N-n-no treasures for  the k-k-k (waits) ...king.
The trailer doors swing open, crashing harsh light upon h He squints into the light, shivering madly.
Pa-rum-pum-pum-pum.

Gabriel is hurling darts again, focused, expressionless.  Bullseye. Merlin and Jumpy haul Rudy in. He collapses at Gabriel's  feet, unable to stand. Still trembling. A couple KIDS scamper into the doorway --
Game room's closed.
-- and Merlin slams the door in their face. Gabriel hurls another bullseye, then retrieves his darts from the board
A for effort, Nick, honestly, A for  effort and an honorary degree. I'm  surprised you never escaped from the  Mountain.
(teeth chattering) ...never... tried...

Nick, here's what we're gonna do. In  the spirit of the season, I'm going  to give you a chance. I understand  you're unhappy. Right outta the  lockup, here against your will, it's  the holidays and there's reruns on  TV. (beat) So we're gonna have a contest.
Gabriel strides back to him, with two darts.

We're each going to get one of these.  Whichever one of us hits closer to  the bullseye... gets what he wants. (beat) You land closer, you get Ashley.   And you guys get to go free. I land  closer... and we start getting your  help.
He lifts Rudy's shaking hand, puts a dart in it. Rudy's  fingers are half-frozen, they don't bend. Gabriel has to  wedge it in.
May the best sportsman win.
Gabriel turns to the board, ten feet away, and tosses his dart. It thunks in the "13" wedge of the outermost ring.
Damn.

He steps aside for Rudy. Rudy struggles to raise his hand trembling badly. He focuses on the board, teeth chatterin tries to reposition his fingers, rears back and throws -- -- except the dart remains in his frozen grip. He brings icy hand back, tries to move his fingers. And the dart fi tumbles out and hits the floor at his feet. Gabriel smiles, steps close.
Got something to say to me, Nick?
...ttt..tt... two out of three?
Gabriel grabs his jacket and hurls him backward. Rudy CRA into a chair, flanked by video games.
What'd you tell that casino manager?
Nnn... nothing...
You were talking to him! What'd you  tell him!?
Nothing... I promise-nothing...
MAYBE SOMETHING ABOUT A ROBBERY?
NO!

Gabriel spins to the dartboard, pulls out a fistful and  wheels. He whistles a dart at Rudy's head. it SMACKS the  wall beside his ear. He whistles another. It TRUNKS right above his head. A th HITS the wall by his chin.
He thought I was some gambler... he  didn't know me... he didn't recognize  me!

I been driving rigs a long time,  Nick. Four, five million miles of  road. Worked for people who wouldn't  keep me on less I was driving fifteen  hours a day. Tell 'em I needed sleep,  I needed rest, shit, they'll hire  someone else...
Gabriel flings another dart. Just misses Rudy's other ear
...Dispatcher's screaming for me to  haul ass, he's got a load on the  runback for me. Shipper's making me  wait for the pickup, receiver's  bitching 'bout the count...
Another dart NAILS the wall, right through Rudy's hair.

...Got the cops at the bottom of  every mountain, got the DOT at the  top. And every day, every day, I see  all those faces in their little airbag  Hot Wheels, moms and pops and jam- faced kiddies, giving me that look  to go to hell and get off their happy  goddamn highway. Hey. They don't  gotta get two thousand miles by  sundown, or the gang don't eat come  sunrise.
Gabriel strides to Rudy, sitting stock-still, his head ri by darts. Stares him down.
It's time for me... to be working  for me. I want mine, Nick. And I  need you. (frightening calm) Did you tell your manager there's  gonna be a robbery?
No, Gabriel... no...
Gabriel pulls the darts free. Backs away again.
...he... he asked me... how I'd heard  about his place... he didn't know it  was me...

head_text.subj: GABRIEL RAISES A DART TO THROW

text: I PROMISE YOU HE DIDN'T KNOW IT WAS  ME!
-- and then lowers it. Believing he's gotten a reprieve,  Rudy relaxes, his shivering coming under control.
Man, Monster... just... just don't  start trying to hit me...
Nick. I been trying to hit you.

Gabriel rears back and WHISTLES another dart. It plugs in Rudy's chest. Rudy screams. Gabriel FIRES another, skewer him in the ribs. Then a third, fourth and fifth. Rudy howls in pain, his body too numb to defend itself. F darts protrude from his chest, colorful plastic featherin and spreading rivulets of blood.
Maybe that'll help sharpen your  memory.
Gabriel stalks close.
Tonight we're gonna take another  look at that map. And this time you're  gonna tell me what I need to know.
Rudy gets hurled inside by Merlin and Jumpy. He hits the  floor beside the bed, where Ashley sits prisoner. Pug sit guard, watching "How The Grinch Stole Christmas" on TV.
Nick! Jesus, Nick --
She falls to his side. Merlin cuffs Rudy's ankle again to the bedframe. He and Jumpy head out --
Pug.
Pug's engrossed in the cartoon. They're singing in Whovil
PUG!
Pug snaps to. Shuts off the TV, spits some chaw on the fl and gone. Rudy and Ashley are left alone.
Nick, oh my God, what'd he do to  you? What'd he do?
She touches his bloodied chest. Rudy winces badly.
He had some points to make...
Ashley helps pull his shirt off, sees the wounds:
Jesus Christ, stay here, don't move,  stay right here --
(near-delirium) All I wanted... was to make it home...  for a little of Dad's turkey, and  Mom's stuffing... Aunt Lisbeth's  acorn gravy... Aunt Mary's cranberry  buns...
Ashley has leapt to the bathroom. She brings wet washclot back to clean and dress --
We'll get there, baby... we'll get  there...
...Haven't had cranberry buns... in  five whole years...
Shh, now. Rest now. Two years, Nick.  You haven't had cranberry buns in  two years.
She kisses him softly. Rudy meets her eyes. Staring to ge his bearings back...
You saved my life. (beat) You could have run, but you didn't.  You saved me.
You saved me.
I saved you because I love you, Nick. (smiles) Why'd you save me?
Rudy studies her hopeful face, attending to his wounds. s weak and distant:

Guy I was in with... car thief... I  used to read your letters to him. I  know they were private... I know,  but... you spend twenty-four hours a  day with somebody, you gotta talk,  y'know? You gotta share. Or the room  gets even smaller. (beat) And sometimes, I'd be reading them,  and he'd close his eyes, get a smile  on his face... and I'd know somewhere  inside he was pretending you were  writing to him -- He'd see your face,  your pictures on the wall... (beat) Some nights I think he fell in love  with you, too.
Rudy touches a hand to her hair.
You gave a couple guys hope, Ashley.   And with hope, there ain't nothing  you can't survive.

Ashley stares, touched, still kneading the cloth into his chest. Rudy struggles up, his face level with hers. She kisses h tenderly. Lingering. And this time Rudy responds, mouth seeking, working down neck. Her eyes flutter closed.
I'm sorry, Nick... I'm so sorry...
Don't say my name...
I love you, Nick...
Ash. Don't say it. Don't say my name.
Ashley hesitates. Carefully strokes his chest. He's still kissing her, softly, still somewhat delirious.
(a small frown) I love you...
As he returns to her lips, mouths joining. Ashley's eyes  close again, as they fold into each other... ...and move slowly, tenderly, back to the floor.
A bitter cold sunset. Through a room's window, Rudy and A lie tangled in sheets on the carpet.
Ashley nestles against him. Rudy stares skyward. Hard.
They'll have guns.
What?
You said they've run guns, in their  trucks. So they'll have guns. To do  this robbery. They'll have serious  guns.
I don't know...
We'll need one.
Ashley frowns. There's a new look in Rudy's eyes.
I'm going to have to be inside that  casino. When it happens. I'll need  to be part of it. I can't just be  drawing some map.
Nick, what are you talking about?
We need to find a way to make me  part of it.
Part of... with them?
Rudy meets her eyes.
If we're helping them with their  robbery, we're gonna be doing more  than just walking away. Like that's  some Christmas bonus.
He nods, scheming the way he's always known.
You want him outta your life? You  want a real New Year to look forward  to? (bravely) If we're gonna do this... we're gonna  do it to get it all.

A medieval-themed biergarten. A happy FAMILY of five sits a booth, singing along to "Good King Wencelas." In the booth beside, Merlin and Pug are holding court.  Merlin's puffing smoke rings. Pug watches dully, chewing:
Knew a guy in Joliet, smoked ten  packs a day like you. His lungs got  so black they couldn't find 'em with  an x-ray.

That right? Shit. I used to run rigs  for a guy loved your chaw there.  Shit rotted out his tongue, had to  build him one outta silicon so the  poor boy could talk. You ever see a  motherfucker with a silicon fucking  tongue?
The Happy Family stops singing. Pug considers, spits a wa

Hell. The guy from Joliet, those  black-ass lungs were the least of  his problems. Got so much smoke in  him his lungs couldn't even hold it.  Got into his system, man. Into his  blood. Coming out his ears, man,  coming out his eyes. Guy'd be walking  the row, smoke'd be puffing out his  skin.
The Happy Family trade discomfited looks. Merlin shrugs,  takes another drag.
This trucker? Met a girl in a bar  one night, she didn't know his  situation. He's drunk, she's drunk,  they get to mackin' hot and heavy  and the woman swallows it. His tongue.  Sucks it right down.
My guy would walk into a room, set  off the goddamn sprinklers.
His lips went next. You ever see  some silicon-fucking-lips?
The Happy Family flees their booth. Pug and Merlin glance over. And grab their leftovers. Rifling the grub:
(with disgust) Vegetarians...

Behind them, Gabriel and Jumpy file into the biergarten,  leading Rudy and Ashley to the booth. Meeting commenced. Rudy, battered and freezer-burnt, gets shoved in first.  Gabriel throws down the casino map:
Start singing.
I have no gifts to bring, pa-rumpum- pum-pum
Sing it in pictures, Nick.
Rudy takes the map, glances at Ashley, and then takes cha For the first time, he's giving the orders:

What you gotta worry about first is  the guards. Place doesn't look much  richer than when I worked there, so  let's figure you're gonna have to  deal with ten of 'em. There'll be  two on the floor, walking the room,  that leaves eight up above. Eyes in  the sky. They see something up,  they're the ones who'll hit the silent  alarm and you're fucked.
How do we take them out?
You gotta get someone upstairs.
How do we do that?
Rudy takes the map, points to the gaming tables area:
Across from blackjack, there's a  security doorway. Keypad access.
What's the code?

Uh... they change it every month. I  wouldn't know. (beat) If there's trouble on the floor,  you'll get security coming through.  what you gotta do, is get inside  that doorway once they do. You gotta  draw 'em out.
Without having them hit the alarms.

I got an idea on that one. Once you're  up there, you gotta hold those guards  down till some backup can get there.  There's a security camera room that  videotapes everything. You've gotta  destroy every last one of those tapes.
What about the money?

You lock down security, you move  behind the cage. You hit the Count  Room. There'll be a guy in there but  he's got no guns; room's accessed by  another code. Cashiers'll know it.  They'll have alarms.
What about the Powwow Safe?
What?
The Powwow Safe. The secret safe.   You said the manager's got a safe in  his office where he hides skim money.
Oh. Right. Yeah. That's, uh upstairs.  Uh. Here. Powwow Safe.
His confident manner wavers. Gabriel notices, narrows his eyes. Rudy quickly grabs the map again:

So. You're gonna need a man through  here, two men at the cage, one to  cover the count. You're gonna need a  lookout outside, a sweeper through  the back, and a gun guarding the  front. (beat) You need six.
We got five. Putting Ashley outside.
You need six.
Gabriel eyes him darkly.
NO.

You go in with five, you're either  leaving an alarm free or an exit  free. Someone hits an alarm, you're  fucked. Someone gets to a phone,  gets outside, 'cross the street,  whatever, you're fucked. You need  six. (nods) Six is me.
No.
You guys get caught, I go away for  good. I got an interest in making  sure you don't. You need a sixth man  covering an exit. What're you gonna  do about it.
Yeah. What're you gonna do about it.
She puts an arm around Rudy, smiles. That's her man.
I want a map of that security level.   Every room, every guard, every thing.
Six men means six guns.
No way.
I'm no threat without a gun.
No, you're not.
There'll be people in that casino.   I can't keep them from leaving if I  don't get a gun. I don't need bullets,  Monster... but I gotta be a threat.
What's the matter, Gabriel? This is  what you wanted him for, isn't it?
Gabriel's eyes don't leave Rudy's.
No gun.

Well. What you guys have to plan  out, then... is how you're going to  get to that cage and that security  level before anybody realizes  anything's wrong. Running in with  ski masks and bullets flying ain't  gonna do it.
That part, Nick... was planned out  the day I read your letters.
What. We all gonna dress up like  cowboys?
Not cowboys, Nick. Not cowboys.
Gabriel smiles.
Not on Christmas Eve.
Pulled open to reveal FIVE SANTA CLAUS SUITS, hanging sid by-side. Red polyester coats and pants, white felt trim a black buckles, black boots and red caps.
As Gabriel lifts a Santa Claus suit and presses it agains Rudy. Ashley, Merlin, Jungy and Pug look on.
You gotta be kidding me.
'Tis the season, convict.
He puts the suit back in the locker, pulls another. Findi Rudy's size.
Can't be attracting attention, right?
What, we walking in there and  delivering toys?
He turns to see Merlin open another locker. This one stac with rifles, carbines and handguns.
Hell yeah.
of a floor plan, a sheet of paper overlaid on Gabriel's m of the casino. A pencil draws a boxy room and labels it  "Security Video Room." Then an eraser wipes it out.
still cuffed to the bedframe, pulled close to a desk. He' sitting, working on the security level map. The door opens; Ashley enters, looking worried:
He wants to see your map.
I'm almost done.
He says he wants it now.
If he wanted a photographic memory,  he shoulda kidnapped one. I'm working  on it here.
Ashley walks over, puts her arms around his neck. Whisper
How are we gonna do this, Nick?
You're the getaway girl. The money's  gonna get to you eventually. Gonna  be my job to be the guy who walks  outta there with it. But I can't do  that without a gun. Any luck talking  to him?
Bullets or no bullets, he won't do  it.
Is there any way you could get into  his truck?
No.
We need a gun, Ash. We need a gun...
Rudy studies his map, then quickly pencils in the "Securi Video Room," in a totally different place than he drew it before. Hands the paper to her.
Here's the Picasso. Is he in his  room?
They all are. Football's on.
(nods, thinks) Keep 'em there for a little while.
Ashley takes the map, frowns. Rudy kisses her gently.

We're gonna get you out of Detroit,  Ash. Get you out of beauty and  fragrances. (smiles, then) Remember that. After all this is  over, when you know me, when you  really know me... remember it was  me.

She searches his eyes, not quite understanding. But smile Rudy smiles back, nods toward the door. Ashley slips out. When she's gone, Rudy stands and turns to the window. Out the Blazer with the "Ice Fishermen Do It All Year Long" b sticker still sits parked. Rudy reaches for his jeans pocket, and pulls out-one of t game room darts, flecked with blood.

head_text.subj: HE GIVES IT A SOLEMN STARE

text: Rudy lies on his back, under the bed frame, dart in hand. tears off the plastic feathering, to get at the cross-sha end, furthest-from the tip. Four protruding metal edges. He finds the Phillips screws on the bedframe, and tries t work the dart-end into the grooves. It scrapes and jags, with pressure he's able to do a quarter-turn at a time. The screw starts spiraling out.
As two metal pieces split apart, and Rudy wriggles his an handcuff off the frame.
As Rudy's hand grabs a paper-covered wire hanger and rips the paper off, untwisting the wire.
As Rudy slides it open, and climbs outside.
Light snow falling. Rudy drops from the second floor wind into some snowy shrubs and an empty parking space. He  stealthily darts ahead to the ice fishermen's Blazer.

Rudy peers in the windows, spotting fishing rods, tackle gear boxes in the back seat. He takes his wire coat hanger, now stretched straight, an slips it between the driver's window and moulding, jammin it around until it trips the door lock. The lock pops up; Rudy pops in --
-- and raids the gear box. Bait, reels, fishing wire. Bon knives. A compass. A first aid kit. A switchblade.
Gun, gun, c'mon, boys like you gotta  be keeping a gun...

He rustles around in the backseat. Ice cooler, open bag o pork rinds, another gear box. Nothing. Some HEADLIGHTS sweep past the Blazer. Rudy ducks down,  pockets the switchblade. Munches some pork rinds.
Rudy scrambles out, heads to try another car, a pickup tr And then suddenly drops to the ground, seeing
stride outside, talking casually, kicking snow on their w toward the Nova. Voices too low to hear.

Rudy crouches behind the pickup, slips around the other s Merlin and Jumpy walk right by him. Rudy criss-crosses through the parking lot, hidden by car heading away from his room's window. His window. Rudy gla back to see if the truckers notice that, but they don't s to. They stand at the Nova, talking. Rudy shivers, waiting. They're not leaving. When their ba turn, Rudy dashes twenty feet to the cover of the buildin He slips around the corner, out of sight.

head_text.subj: AROUND THE SIDE OF THE HOTEL

text: Rudy hops through snowdrifts, pressed to the wall, moving toward a side entry -- -- when he stops, hearing a woman's LAUGHTER. Above his head are a row of windows. Reflections of rippl water on the ceiling inside. It's the hotel pool behind t wall. Sounds of SPLASHES. Murmured VOICES. Rudy stands absolutely still. His breaths stop frosting.  Because his breathing has stopped.

Rudy creeps down the darkened hall, past a sign that read "Pool CLOSED. Open 9 am to 9 pm, No Lifeguard on Duty." Rudy steps closer, back to a wall, standing in shadow. Th small pool becomes visible, flickering blue water. From a unseen end, a figure splashes backwards into view -- It's Ashley. Hair wet, naked beneath the surface. Smiling and splashing someone offscreen --
...and he's saying "We're not gonna  help him just to walk away. If we're  gonna help him... we're gonna get it  all...
She splashes again. Taunting --
...he wants to help now, he wants to  rob it now we could probably stay  right here, he'd go on and rob it by  himself --
As Gabriel steps into view, also undressed, moving toward her in the pool.
He wants the money.
No, baby. He wants me.
Gabriel reaches her, puts his arms around her. She smiles
He wants... your "sister"...
...whoever she is.
And they kiss, entwining together, reflections and ripple A steamy embrace.
Nick Mason's gonna help us more than  we ever dreamed.
in the shadows, hearing them. Staring into darkness.
Gabriel turns with Ashley, wrapped together. Moving slow.
All those letters are about to pay  off, baby... all those letters...
To all those cons...
Searching for a money man...
We musta written what, twenty of  'em? And they were before this guy.   One, two letters apiece, ten to the  racetrack guy in Leavenworth --
-- till he fucked his parole --
-- plus the forty to Mason... how  many letters is that?
That's a book, baby. (presses closer) That's a book of love.
They kiss again. Gabriel strokes her wet hair:
I can't take watching you touch him.   I can't take his hands on you.
One more day, baby. One more day to  Christmas.
I've been doing good, though.
Didn't have to hit me so fucking  hard. Didn't have to throw me outta  the goddamn truck.
Didn't have to send me down a fucking  mountain.
What, he should see me help you catch  him?
still in the shadows, welling with betrayal.

He's shown us the setup, he's drawn  us the map, he's helped us do the  plan. He wants a gun, give him a  gun. Take the bullets out, whatever,  but give him the gun. The more  manpower we've got in there, the  better. He won't try and make his  move till the money's in hand.
He'll be dead when he does.
Gabriel and Ashley rock slowly, coupled, in the water.
Y'know something, baby? If you were  my sister? I'd still want to wake up  Christmas morning with you...
Mmm, baby. And I'd still want to be  the tinsel round your tree...
And as their words turn to moans and murmurs...
Rudy is gone.
Rudy strides a corridor, eyes dead ahead, passing a stair on his way toward the "Exit" sign posted above a door. He almost there, marching fast --
Here's my present to you, truck  drivers --
Where the hell's Gabriel?
-- and Rudy dives to the stairwell, out of sight just as  Merlin and Jumpy stride back inside.
With his girlfriend. Making up for  "Nick" time. I'm going down to the  bar, you want something?
Get me a brew. I'm gonna check on  our convict.
They separate, Jumpy down the hall, Merlin to the stairs
Merlin trudges upward, while Rudy steps from hiding one f down. Checks the hall for Jumpy, then races out --

Rudy slams out the side door, scrambling straight for the same Blazer. He jimmies the lock again, leaps in, tears f the engine panel and searches for ignition wires like a p Stripping the plastic, trying to spark contact --
Catch, dammit, catch! Like riding a  bike, it's like riding a bike!
But there's nothing. The engine won't start.
Merlin reaches the second floor, steps into the hall.
Rudy jumps from the Blazer, looks at the lot, the highway the woods. His own footprints in the dusting snow.
How far you gonna get, Rudy...
Realizing the answer, Rudy looks to his room's window. Fo to race back. He tries clambering the wall, standing an  shrubbery, but he can't reach. He whirls, desperate. And his eyes find the Blazer.
Merlin ambles the corridor. Approaching Rudy's room.
Rudy flings open the Blazer door, slams the emergency bra down. Forces the gearshift into "Reverse."
Merlin reaches Rudy's door. Searches his pockets for the  key.
Rudy darts to the front of the Blazer, slipping and slidi on asphalt ice. He drops to his knees, pushing on the fro bumper. The wheels start to move.
Merlin finds a room key. Puts it in the lock. Turns the h but the door won't open. Merlin checks the key.
My room.

The Blazer starts to roll backwards, toward the snowy shr ringing the building. Headed for the empty parking space  below Rudy's window. Rudy keeps pushing. The Blazer picks speed, rolling on its own.
Merlin searches his pockets again, finds the right key.

The Blazer rolls toward the building. Rudy scrambles to h feet, runs after it, leaps his left foot onto the bumper, the right foot onto the hood, then onto the roof -- -- getting two roof-steps worth of running start -- -- as the Blazer slows to a rest against the snowy shrubs -- and Rudy dives into the air, torpedoing himself right  through the window to his room --
-- where he crashes headlong to the floor, turning a  somersault and landing sprawled across the carpet.
The key in the lock, Merlin hears the crash --

-- and as Merlin opens the door, he finds Rudy sitting ca on the floor, ankle-cuff locked once again to the bedfram Spreading a deck of cards out before him. Starting a game of solitaire. He looks up.
Hey.

Merlin frowns, takes a suspicious look around the room. T window's open. Rudy continues his card game. Merlin watches him for a long time. Then pulls the door s Once he's gone, Rudy collapses to the floor. Breathing ha heart pounding. The cards go flying.

The LIGHTS go out. Rudy creeps back to the window, checks outside... and stops still. In parking lot... ...a cigarette glow burns inside the Nova. From the drive seat. It's Merlin. Now watching. Rudy steps back into the shadows. Closing window and watc the falling snow. Caged again, after all.
Pitch dark. Rudy asleep on the floor, as Ashley creeps ba in. Seeing he's asleep, she lies beside him, pulls a blanket  over them both, nestles into his body and kisses him.
Merry Christmas-Eve, my love. My  love, my love. Merry Christmas-Eve...
Ashley closes her eyes. With a smile. A moment later, Rudy's eyes open. Turning to look at her  smiling, sleeping face... with a convict's vengeful stare
In a elfin cap, smiling cheerfully:
Hello, gentlemen. And how can we  help you on this holiday morning?
Three grim faces.
Checking out.

The three truckers stride to the Nova, where Jumpy guards Rudy and Ashley. In the b.g., the Ice Fishermen are by th car, wondering how the hell it switched parking spaces  overnight. Gabriel marches straight to Rudy and SLUGS him in the gut Rudy hits the snow --
Gabriel!
That's for the hundred bucks worth  of pay-per-view. (then KICKS him) And that's for the two hundred you  took outta your minibar.
(chokes, pained) You guys were paying for the room, I  just figured --

Gabriel KICKS him again, then pulls a handgun, points it Rudy's head. Ashley screams, rushes him -- -- as Gabriel's gun SHOOTS a thin stream of water into Ru face. It's a forty-five caliber squirt gun.
(cruel smile) You wanted a weapon, convict? You  got one.
Gabriel tosses the water pistol onto Rudy's chest. Jumpy Pug haul him up. With venom:
Merry Christmas-Eve.
The Motor City Monster cruises the snowy landscape, with  Lake Superior beyond. Pug drives the Nova in convoy.
Gabriel hands copies of Rudy's sketched map to Merlin and Jumpy. Rudy and Ashley are in the sleeper.
Commit this thing to memory. Every  guard, every exit... don't tape it  to your fuckin, wrist: remember it.  That's the Gospel right there. The  Gospel. Matthew, Mark, Luke and  John...
Rudy watches them studying his made-up map. Ashley stroke his arm, gives a loving smile. Rudy stares at her. He smiles right back.
The rig and the Nova blow by a roadsign: "Now Entering  Powahachee Indian Reservation Lands."

The storage locker with the Santa suits SLAMS open. Merlin's hands PULL automatics and shotguns from the weap chest. Pug's hands UNLOAD ammo. A red-and-white Santa coat gets PULLED ON and BUTTONED UP Jumpy's hands apportion GUNS and AMMO on a picnic table. Black Santa boots STAMP TIGHT in the snow. A shoulder-strap ASSAULT RIFLE gets hidden under a Santa  coat. AMMO CLIPS are taped inside a fat black buckle-belt. A HANDGUN gets tucked under a Santa hat. And the rig's trailer doors come CRASHING SHUT.

Lake Superior shimmers in the dying light. The rig's in t empty rest area lot. On a nearby bank, four men in Santa  Claus suits and one woman without sit scattered at picnic tables, guns at their sides. Staring out at the lake.
sit apart from the rest. Rudy in a red suit, black boots, cap in hand. Ashley's head is in his lap, watching the sk
Where should we go, Nick? When we're  gone from here... where should we  go...
The Nova drives into the lot. Pug gets out, carrying seve fast-food bags. Hurrying to stay warm:
Okay, who had the cheeseburger with  bacon; what about a roast beef, I've  got two roast beefs here --
Cheeseburger 'n bacon's mine --
I got a bacon too; there another  bacon in there?
I got a bacon for him and a bacon  for me; there's four cheeseburgers  and two roast beefs --
Somebody better give me something  with some goddamn bacon --
As they continue chow dispersal, Rudy stares over the lak Distant. Not even aware Ashley's there.

This time right now... Dad's stacking  wood out back, getting ready for  tomorrow. Little blaze in the  fireplace. Mom's setting out the  good silver, hanging her cinammon  sticks, up in the doorways. Getting  out her scratchy old records...  singing along...
Rudy smiles to himself. He's got a faraway look.
I don't know where you're going.   But I'm going home.
We go together, Nick. Wherever... we  go together. Remember?
Well. I'm going home.

sits by the water, staring over the lake too. With a whit cotton Santa beard resting on his chin. He unwraps his ro beef sandwich, pulls his beard down to his neck, and take savage bite. Munches away, stares to Rudy and Ashley. She meets his ey Gabriel smiles. And looks again to the water.
The snowy rest stop, the glistening lake. And the six fig scattered, watching day turn to night...
The neon axe lit up in full regalia, with Christmas light now strung along the building's roof. There are fewer tha dozen cars in the parking lot.
Filled with the JINGLING, JANGLING slots, but there's onl two FAT WOMEN sitting at them. Three INDIANS at a poker t An OLD TIMER in his 90's playing blackjack.

A ragged headquarters, looking down to the casino level  through smoked glass. Desks, file cabinets, pin-up  centerfolds. A room with video monitors to one side. Stai to a camera catwalk that rings the casino. Jack Bangs is at a table of wassail and cookies. He opens battle of brandy, pours a bit into the punch, and takes t bottle for himself. Walks over to his HEAD OF SECURITY,  watching the lack of activity below:
And all through the house... not a  creature was stirring... (sighs) Why don't you go ahead and send most  of your guys home, Ed.
Thanks, Jack. Merry X-mas.
The boss smiles, heads off. Jack Bangs swigs his brandy,  eyes his high-tech security gear glumly:
Hell. Nobody even comes here to  cheat...
The Nova pulls into the lot and parks. Merlin, Pug and As inside. On the road, the Motor City Monster slows to an i stop. In the cab, Gabriel turns to Rudy and Jumpy:
Go.
Rudy gives Gabriel a withering look. He and Jumpy climb o Gabriel's rig rumbles up the road. [NOTE: All five men, save Ashley, from now till story's e are in their Santa Claus suits.]
make their way across the lot, heading for the entrance.
Hey Jumpy, I want to ask you  something. You have any problem with  the fact that we're on our way to  take millions of dollars from an  Indian casino?
The Native American considers. As they walk:

Nick. It's true that Indian gaming's  gone a long way toward restoring  wealth and pride to communities who've  been economically isolated and  enslaved for centuries. Stronger  infrastructure, better schools, higher  employment... they're all the results  of reservation casino success stories.  Still, many natives believe that  these are temples to a godless  materialism and greed that will only  infect the souls of indigenous peoples  until their love of money has  destroyed the spiritual values their  ancestors died to protect and their  homelands have become no different  from any United States suburb,  satellite city or industrial park.   Destroying the Indian legacy once  and for all and leaving behind a  nation of selfish, angry natives, of  which I, it's true, am one --
-- as they hit the Tomahawk's doors --
-- and SLAM inside, stumbling into each other, suddenly  LAUGHING and slapping backs. Surveying the casino:
Hey-hey, egg nog for everybody!
Rudy spreads his Santa arms wide and whoops. Jumpy laughs with him, steadying his balance. Drunken and slurred:
Let's win some MONEY! MONEY-MONEY-  MONEY!
The few gamblers inside look up at the commotion. Bear th Bartender. Two CASHIERS and one WAITRESS. Ed the Security Boss strides over, smiling tightly:
How you gentlemen doing tonight?
We're out of work tonight, that's  how! Christmas Eve! We're out of  work!
(shakes his hand) Hi, Santa Claus, how are you. He's  with Sears, I'm with Wal-Mart, twas  the season...
We're all outta gifts, boys and girls,  but we got charitable donations!
Rudy grabs a wad of bills from his pocket, drops some to floor. Jumpy retrieves them --
...bunch of us got together for the  union party. Hey, how late are you  open?
(eyes on the money) All night and all day.
I got wampum for the Cocktail Waitress  Civil Defense Fund! Are there any  representatives here present?
A Waitress sidles close; checks with the Boss. He nods ok
What can I get ya, Santa?
Santa drinks American beer.
(to Jumpy) What's your game, guys?
Blackjack. Got a buddy from  Woolworth's out parking the sleigh.
The Security Boss stares him down. Then:
Good luck, gentlemen.
He steps aside and indicates the tables. Jumpy claps him the back, pushes Rudy on through the slots.
Gabriel's truck at the roadside, hazards on, with signal  triangles as if broken down. Gabriel places the last one, hurries back down the casino road.
Ashley sits between Merlin and Pug. Gabriel jogs by the c Ashley checks her watch:
Three minutes.
Rudy and Jumpy sit at a blackjack table, beside the Old T Jovial ad libs as the Waitress brings Rudy's beer. Rudy  doubles down, busts, and gets belligerent: RUDY (to the Old Timer)
That was my card, pop!  My card! You hit for  my card! OLD TIMER
I... sorry, Mister... RUDY
That was my king! OLD TIMER
Well...sorry...
Behind them, Gabriel SLAMS through the casino doors.
Woolworth's!
Hey, Sears! Hey, Wal-Mart!
