Saved you a seat, man. Get in on a  hand here!
Gabriel sidles to the table, claps Rudy on the back.
(re: Old Timer) Careful. Watch out for this guy.
They throw chips in. The Waitress circles around:
What can I get ya, Santa?
American beer.
The Old Timer hits and stays. Rudy hits and busts:
POP! That was My card!
But... I had a five...
You're hitting for MY cards!
Ashley's eyes on her watch. Nods to Merlin and Pug:
Go.
Jumpy has left the table, sidling to a change booth, glan at his watch. Passes a $100 bill:
Could Fat-Man-With-Flying-Horse get  some quarters, please?
Gabriel slides off his stool, punches Rudy in the shoulde
Be back, Wal-Mart. Watch my bank.
Rudy nods, slugging beer. He's becoming an unruly drinker The Old Timer motions to hit; but before the Dealer can p the card, Rudy slams the table, points to it:
That is my card, guy. My card.
He hit, mister.
He didn't hit. (to Old Timer) You didn't hit. You're not hitting.
But you don't even know what it is!
The dealer hits grandpa to twenty-one. Then hits Rudy and busts him. Rudy stares darkly.

head_text.subj: IN THE HALL TO THE BATHROOMS

text: Gabriel walks to the men's room door. Then stops. Adjusts the rifle under his red coat. And turns back.
Jumpy is handed a bucket of quarters.
Merlin and Pug march toward the entrance, hands in pocket
The Security Boss returns upstairs, beside Jack Bangs, wh watching the video monitors. On one screen, a parking lot cam shows Merlin and Pug approaching:
There's two more coming.
Hell, there we go. That's the spirit.
He drunkenly clinks his battle to the Security Boss, wass The Boss frowns.
Jack? Is there a union for department  store Santas?
Rudy bolts up suddenly, sends chips and his chair to the  carpet. Points sternly at the Old Timer, slurring:
Switch seats with me.
What? No...
You're taking my money. Switch seats  with me. Switch seats with me if  you're not taking my money --
I'm ninety-two years old --
Then get yourself another table!   You're hitting Santa's cards and  you're taking Santa's money!
There is no other table --
THEY'LL OPEN ONE!
Rudy grabs the blackjack table and wrenches with all his  might, OVERTURNING IT, cards, chips, cash scattering --

Two SECURITY GUARDS at the door (?) rush for Rudy -- Gabriel steps from the restroom, hall, moves toward the k door to the security level -- Jumpy carries his bucket of quarters past the cage -- Rudy tackles the Old Timer, fists and false teeth flying, the Guards arrive, trying to wrench him off the poor guy
(hard whisper) Stay down, pop! Trust me, stay down!
As Gabriel stops just beyond the keypad door --
The Security Boss grabs more men, while Jack Bangs merely smiles at the sight. Guards wrestling a drunken Santa:
Help them down there! HELP them!
Three guards CHARGE out of the keypad door -- -- right past Gabriel, who slips deftly inside --
-- opening his coat, pulling his assault rifle --
Right at the top of the stairs, right at the top of the  stairs... -- charging to the top, starting right and running SMACK  into a wall. He spins, sees the doorway's on his left --
with three doors. Gabriel stops at the first, grips his g
Video room, video room --
-- and swings open a closet bathroom. He frowns, confused Jumps to the second door --
Map said video room --
-- and swings open a storage closet. Gabriel grumbles, le to the third door and flings it open,
Map said goddamn video room!

head_text.subj: TO REVEAL THE MAIN SECURITY AREA

text: -- with two Guards sitting at their posts, and Jack Bangs the Security Boss and the Video Guard in the doorway to t video room. Which is on the far opposite side of the spac As they turn to see the furious Santa Claus with the AK-4
WHAT THE FUCK IS GOING ON??!!!
-- as he SPRAYS the ceiling with GUNFIRE.

Where the RIFLE sounds, just as Jumpy grips his bucket of quarters at the cashier's cage and wheels -- -- throwing a fragmentation grenade's worth of quarters a the two Cashiers! Bits Of metal flying between the bars.  They SCREAM, stepping backwards in defense -- -- and Jumpy whips a sawed-off shotgun from his coat --
Step BACK from the desks!
The five guards wrestling Rudy spin and scramble, pulling pistols from shoulder holsters as --
CHARGES through the casino entrance, shotgun held --
DROP 'EM! DROP, DROP, DROP!!!
(from the floor) DROP THE GUNS! NOW!

But the guards don't. Whirling on Merlin -- -- who OPENS FIRE, BLASTING two of the guards off their f Rudy stays on the ground, covering his head, holding the  petrified Old Timer down -- -- as the other three guards FIRE back, forcing Merlin to race behind the slots. BULLETS rip into slot machines -- -- as GUNSHOTS ring out from the casino restaurant. Two o the Guards spin to look behind them as -- -- PUG storms in, contorted glee, twin pistols BLAZING,  popping a steel flurry into an outgunned Guard. Merlin spins from hiding behind the slots. He and Pug bot OPEN FIRE, blowing away the two remaining men from both s One of the guards falls in front of Rudy, gun in hand -- -- but as Rudy-reaches for the guy's pistol --
Hold it right there, Nick. Your squirt  gun's all you need.
Merlin steps to him, gun aimed. He and Pug collect the Gu weapons.
Cover 'em.
Rudy gets to his feet, pulls the water pistol from his po Moves to round up the Old Timer, the waitress, the Poker  Players and the Fat Slots Women.
Sorry, guys. But what the hell were  you doing here an Christmas Eve  anyway.
The two Guards lie on the floor, with Security Boss and V Guard. And the ruined Jack Bangs.
No... not here... please... mister...
Gabriel storms to the video room's doorway. Slams a new c

Mister. I'm begging, 'kay? I'm  begging. This is not some card club,  'kay? This is the Tomahawk. We're an  international gaming destination.  We're in guidebooks. You can't do  this... you can't do this to me...
Show's over.
He OPENS FIRE, BLOWING AWAY the wall of monitors and VCR' recording the robbery. SPARKS and METAL fly.

Ashley waits in the Nova, checking her watch. Behind her RED WRANGLER rolls in and parks. A FIRE CHIEF and his DEP just off-duty, stroll toward the casino, laughing. Ashley sinks low, panicked. Presses her HORN. The firemen spin around but don't see her. They shrug. Keep walking.
Rudy forces the gamblers and employees behind the bar. On the floor with Bear the Bartender, whispering hard:
Get down and stay down, and you're  gonna be fine. Just don't do anything.  My friends are disturbed --
The hostages do as told. Rudy breathes relief, squirt gun hand. And then stares at the array of bottles around him.
Merlin and Pug force the cashiers to the floor:
What's the security code to the Count  Room?
Security code? What security code?   You just use a key!
NICK SAID SECURITY CODE!
Who's Nick?!

Pug bangs the guy's head off the floor, stalks to the Cou Room door. Just a key lock. Pug BLOWS it away with his gu kicks the door open -- -- and gets SHOT TO HELL by three COUNT MEN inside, pisto blazing! Pug puppets, dead. A wad of chaw hits the ceilin Stunned Merlin FIRES BACK.
-- as the Firemen hear the GUNFIRE, pulling holstered pis
-- while Merlin dives out of the cage, joining Jumpy, tak cover as the Count Men FIRE AWAY -- -- as Rudy scrambles back from the bar --
You said no GUNS in there! NO GUNS!
Merlin and Jumpy leap up, GUNS BLAZING, firing through th cage bars at the Count Men. Killing all three just as --
storm through the doors, pistols ready --
DROP IT! DROP THE GUNS!
Merlin and Jumpy are caught. Trade a look. And let their  weapons fall, turning just as --

CRASHES through the casino doors, MOWING DOWN the firemen The car SLAMS inside, crashing into slot machines. The sl send SPARKS showering into the air. Which set off the cas floor's SPRINKLERS. The room fills with watery spray. Ashley swiftly climbs out of the mangled vehicle. Rudy st darkly at her. She knows he knows. And she doesn't care.
(wild-eyed) WHERE'S THE FUCKING CASH, NICK!
Yeah. That's love.
She storms on by. The slots pay off behind her.
Jumpy, Merlin, Ashley and Rudy step inside the Count Room There are stacks and stacks of bills. Ashley smiles wide, throws Jumpy three laundry sacks.
MOVE, MOVE, MOVE!
Merlin, meanwhile, slams Rudy against the wall:
You knew there were guns in here!
Merlin, I didn't know --
You got Pug killed! You tried to get  ME killed! You just lost your Get- Outta-Jail-Free --
I promise you, I didn't know!
As Merlin puts a gun to Rudyls head --
(over casino speakers) Santa Claus, Santa Claus, and Santa  Claus... would you please bring our...  mapmaker... to the security level?
Merlin stares daggers at Rudy. Shoves the gun away.

Gabriel stands at the windows overlooking the watery carn The taped jingle of slots still plays. Poor Jack Bangs lies on his desk, beaten to a pulp. Blood runs down his face and shark suit. Tears and shock:
I can't go back to Vegas... I can't...  go back...
What the hell is with this place?   Thought the video room was back there --
Merlin and Jumpy lead Rudy in. Ashley follows. They carry bulging money sacks. Gabriel stares Rudy down.
I told you not to fuck us with that  map, Nick. I told you not to, and  you did. How am I s'posed to keep my  promises now? (Ashley joins him) How's she s'posed to keep hers?
He kisses her hard. Sloppy. Grins. Then points to Jack Bangs:
He won't tell us where it is. The  Powwow Safe.
I don't know... what you're...
Gabriel hammers him with the butt of his rifle. CRACK.
THE POWWOW SAFE! WHERE IS THE POWWOW  SAFE!
What... Powwow...
The Powwow Safe where you steal your  money! Where you cheat your Indians!
I don't steal any --
Gabriel CRACKS him again. And again. Rudy winces. Gabriel grabs Rudy, pulls him over.
We KNOW about the Powwow Safe! We  KNOW it's in here! We KNOW how you  work! Because WE know who's worked  for you! (smiles) Remember a guy named Nick Mason!?  A  security guard named Nick Mason!?
Gabriel pushes Rudy's head toward the desk. Jack Bangs,  drooling blood, eyes swollen, turns his face to see.
Nick... Mason... ?
Jack Bangs stares at Rudy. Rudy stares back.
...so where is he?
(laughs, mocking) Where is he?! Where is he?!
He's not Nick Mason...
The smile fades from Gabriel's face.
Nick Mason... worked for me two years  ago. This man... (a spark of recognition) ...he's some cowboy...
Gabriel grabs Rudy, slams him against a wall. He glares a Ashley for answers. She stares in disbelief. Rudy meets her eyes.
Fucked the wrong guy, Ashley. (shrugs) Story of your life.
I did time with Nick Mason, Monster.   Told you that from the start.
Ashley's putting it all together...
You... you... YOU --
We still gonna spend Christmas  together?
Ashley CHARGES him. Gabriel stops her; Merlin and Jumpy h hold her back. Gabriel spins on Rudy with his rifle:
You are lucky, convict. You're  spending Christmas with the birthday  boy himself --
Hey! HEY! THERE IS A POWWOW SAFE!
Gabriel hesitates. Doesn't fire.
I did time with Nick Mason, remember?   I knew he worked here, didn't I!?   Well, some shit he told me!
Rudy steels himself for the shot. It still doesn't come.
Nick told me his manager kept a safe  in his office, his stealing safe.  His Powwow Safe. I swear, please...   Nick told me. (looks to Jack Bangs) Behind the liquor cabinet.

Jack Bangs dully meets Rudy's eyes. Gabriel steps to the liquor cabinet, feels at the shelves They split in the middle. And there is a combination safe mounted in the back. Gabriel turns to Jack Bangs:
Open it.
He pulls him off the desk. Jack Bangs wavers, struggling. looks at Gabriel. Then at Rudy.
I can't go back to Vegas...
OPEN IT!!!
Jack Bangs steps to the safe. Spins the lock. Spins back. Spins forward. Click. Jack Bangs looks at Rudy.
(nods) Pow. Wow.
And Jack Bangs opens it -- -- reaching inside in the same swift motion, so that as t safe swings open to reveal it's a rack of WEAPONS that li inside, Jack Bangs already has an Uzi in hand --
VEEEEGGGGAAAASSSS!!!

BULLETS as he turns back to the room -- -- sending Gabriel, Ashley, and Merlin diving for the flo Jumpy can't get down, as BULLETS riddle him dead -- -- and BLOW OUT the smoked windows overlooking the casino Jack Bangs keeps turning in a madman's circle -- -- BLOWING OUT the windows to the parking lot, shattering the liquor, sending Rudy scrambling under his desk --
I CAN'T! GO BACK! I CAN'T! GO BACK!  I CAN'T! GO BACK!
GO!!!
He and Ashley both scramble for the windows, jumping out  with two of the money sacks --
-- and landing on poker tables below, overturning them -- Jack Bangs keeps FIRING, into the casino, SHREDDING the t but missing Gabriel and Ashley -- as he JUMPS right after them.

Merlin scrambles to his feet, whirling with his gun, look for Rudy -- -- just as Rudy slams into him. Merlin's SHOT hits the  ceiling. The two of them CRASH down, wrestling and rolling toward parking lot window. Two guns spill to the floor. Rudy gra one, just as Merlin kicks out, leaping up -- -- and freezes, seeing Rudy's got a pistol on him. Before Merlin can make a move, Rudy fires -- -- and a thin stream of water shoots out. Leaving a stain his shirt. It's the water pistol. Rudy stares blankly. As Merlin swiftly snatches the second gun, a real gun, of the floor. Rudy's dead to rights.
Hell. I'm gonna take pleasure in  this...

With the gun on Rudy, Merlin finds a cigarette in his poc Pops it between his lips, raises a lighter's flame -- -- and hesitates. Sniffing the air. Looking down. At the stain on his shirt. His lighter still lit --
Me too.

-- and Rudy fires the water pistol again, this time catch Merlin's lighter, which turns the stream into a ARC OF FI He's filled alcohol in the gun! FLAMING LIQUOR shoots into Merlin's face and eyes. He dro the handgun. Rudy keeps squeezing the squirt gun, spreadi the fire down his neck and chest. Merlin howls wildly -- -- and staggers back, blind and helpless, pinwheeling him
-- and CRASHING down on the hood of a Pontiac, head throu the windshield, boots on the bumper, dead. Flames flicker
Smoke 'em if you got 'em.

Gabriel and Ashley have scrambled to the Nova, tumbling i with the money sacks. Jack Bangs gets up, stalking toward them, still FIRING and babbling. Gabriel FIRES back, hitting Bangs in the chest. He stagge but stays upright. His bullets RIDDLE the car, shattering the windshield, but Gabriel and Ashley keep their heads d slamming it into reverse -- -- and burning rubber backwards out the casino entrance,  into the parking lot, and speeding out of sight. Jack Bangs stops shooting. He staggers back toward the bar, totters there, and turns gun still raised. Rudy stands at the base of the stairs to the security lev He puts his hands up, until he sees the dying look in Ban face. The uzi drops to the ground. A silence. Even the slots have stopped.
I'm sorry.
Jack Bangs stares blankly. Surveys the wreckage of his po man's empire. And gives a small shrug.
That's why they call it gambling.
He slumps against the bar and hits the floor. Dead.
Rudy ambles out into the snowy night. The lot is quiet. H takes a few wary steps toward the road -- -- and hears a CLICK. He turns to see Ashley standing beh him, with a gun. Shaking her pretty head.
Your turn.
Rudy shuts his eyes for the end.
The Nova drives up a ramp into the back of the truck, in  reverse. Gabriel gets out, pulls shut the trailer. Ashley collects the hazard triangles. They hurry to the cab.
The Motor City monster storms through the night, passing couple POLICE CARS, sirens wailing, speeding the other wa
Gabriel and Ashley inside, with the money sacks:
With the wrong fucking guy! We took  the place down with the wrong fucking  guy! Is that Christmas?! Huh?! Is  that Christmas?!
He grabs Ashley, kisses her wildly. Then turns back --
Where Rudy lies sideways, hands bound with his Santa belt
God bless us every one...

A winding two-lane road, overlooking a small ravine at a  grassy overlook. The road is dusted with snow; there's be no traffic here for awhile. The Motor City Monster steams to a stop beyond the overlo Then starts backing up, such that the gate of the trailer fifteen feet from the edge of the ridge. A hundred-foot drop into the ravine below. Gabriel and Ashley pile out of the cab. They lift the tra gate, extend the tire ramps. The ramps run from the trail to five feet away from, the ravine drop.
Gabriel pulls Rudy out of the sleeper. Marches him back -
-- and gives him a look. Forces him to his knees. Ashley in the truck trailer, splashing the inside of the Nova wi a can of gasoline.

You almost got away with it, Santa.  Got outta the Tomahawk, got to your  car, got halfway to Canada till you  caught some ice in the road. By the  time you hit bottom down there, whole  car was burning like a comet.  Musta  burned up all that money too.
Rudy glances to the trailer. Ashley tosses a couple handf of bills into the car.

Buncha guys in red suits busted in,  they'll say. Started shooting. They  won't be able to remember... if it  was three, or four... or five. Four  dead Santas and some burned-up cash.  Merry Christmas, The End.
Was it your plan, Monster? Or was it  hers.
Gabriel smiles at him.
She told me 'bout the convict  magazines. Had to figure there'd be  some boys in the pen with some useful  knowledge. With nobody to talk to.  Nobody to listen. So we stocked up  on stationery.
Ashley hops down. Gabriel puts an arm around her.
Hard life being a trucker's girl.
Rudy eyes Ashley. She stares darkly back.
I saved your life.
You shouldn't have.
He did love you, you know. Nick. He  did love you.
Who wouldn't.
So cold. But Rudy doesn't pause.

Maybe this is where you wanted him,  Ashley. At the bottom of a ravine,  dead as ice with a burnt-up heart.  Maybe. But it didn't happen. 'Cause  what you did for him was make him  the happiest held ever been. You  showed him hope and taught him mercy.   And he died a peaceful man. You wanted  to destroy some convict... and all  you did was save his soul. Remember  that. Love your money and remember  that.
Ashley shivers, a touch shaken. But steels herself:
Merry Christmas, Rudy.
I'm glad it was me.
Merry Christmas.
Get in the car.
Gabriel hauls him up. Marches him to the trailer. Rudy st at the ramp. Gabriel pushes. Rudy doesn't move.
Get in the CAR!
How'd you know my name...
He turns back to Ashley.
What?
Rudy. How'd you know my name?
What are you talking about?
Rudy looks at Gabriel. He's frowning. To Ashley:
You said Merry Christmas, Rudy.
I... you told me your name was Rudy.  You told me a million times, back in  the truck, telling me you weren't  Nick --
No --
You were screaming you weren't Nick!  And we just didn't fucking believe  you!
But I never said Rudy.
You said it a million times!
I never told you my name.
He stares her down. Then stares at Gabriel.
Ash?
How'd you know my name was Rudy.
Ash?
How'd you know my name.
Ashley stares daggers. Shakes her head ruefully --
Men.

-- and pulls a handgun, SHOOTING Gabriel in the heart. Gabriel falls to his knees in the snow, his mouth a ring shock. Blood spurts through his red coat. He stares at As incredulous. She steps forward and PUTS another bullet in his neck. Ga falls still. Ashley's breath frosts in the cold. Rudy watches her. Finally, she meets Rudy's eyes. They st each other down for a long moment, before:
Where is he.

A silence. No one moves. And finally, the CRUNCH of footsteps from around the side the trailer. And WHISTLING. "Silver Bells." A shadow moves across the snow behind the trailer, and so steps into Rudy and Ashley's view. It's Nick Mason. Alive and well.
Merry Christmas, Rudy.
Ashley smiles. Her muscles-and-mustache man pen pal is he
I missed you, beautiful.
I missed you too, Nicky baby.
They share a passionate kiss. Ashley malts at the sight o him, embracing happily. Then turns to Rudy:
For your information. I never fuck  the wrong guy.
Rudy just stands there, his mind playing catch-up.

Oh, hey. Have you two been properly  introduced? Sweetness, this is Rudy  Duncan, I did almost a year with him  in the Mountain. Read him all your  letters, talked about you all the  time, made him feel like he really  knew you. (turns to Rudy) My friend... wantcha to meet Millie  Bobek. 'Member Millie Bobek, dontcha?  My girlfriend fore I went in? Worked  at that bar in Motor City, where I  manslaughtered that guy? Hell. Didn't  talk about her much once the Ashley  letters started coming, I guess.
Rudy doesn't notice it's started to snow.

Millie here used to serve drinks to  these gunrunning truckers, real big  talkers, talking bout a real score  one day. I was in the Mountain, man,  what the hell, why not let her get  friendly with 'em? Let her tell 'em  an idea she had, 'bout writing guys  in prison. Getting one who could  show 'em a sure thing.
She set them up. All of them.
Why not have her pretend to find me?   Pretend to write me and reel me in?   Tell her new trucker-man she'd pose  as some sister of his named Ashley?
And you set me up.
Always wanted to rob that casino,  Rudy. Way back when I worked there.   What better way than to get some  guys to rob it for me.
Nick shrugs. Prods Rudy up the ramp. Into the trailer:

Paid the Alamo ten bucks to put the  shiv in me. He's a lifer, what does  he care. Paid a hospital guard fifty  to put out the story I was dead.  Once the wound healed up... (notes cash-sacks) Got out of the Mountain this morning.   And tonight I'm a rich man.
How'd you know I'd do it.
Do what?
Walk outta there and tell her I was  you.
Nick looks back at Ashley.
Because every time I read her letters,  Rudy... you listened. (to Ashley) Keep your gun on him.
Nick forces Rudy inside, unties the belt from his wrists lashes them to the bottom of the steering wheel.
Five Santas walked into that Tomahawk,  Rudy. That's what the witnesses'll  say. So we gotta have five Santas  not walk out. Gotta have five... (working) This'll burn right away... in the  fire...
Nick gets Rudy's wrists locked to the wheel. He laughs.
Hell, you never needed to convince  Ashley you were me. Just the dumb  fucking truckers. I figured I'd talked  enough about the Tomahawk in the pen  for you to get by --
Talked about the old man's weapons  stash, probably forgot I'd remember
Hm. Well. They'd have killed you if  you weren't me, Rudy. We knew you'd  start convincing 'em soon enough.
Nick slams the car door, locking Rudy in.
They had the weapons and the  willpower. We just gave them their  inside man.
You gave them me.
I gave them me. (shrugs, smiles) Said some nice things about me, Rudy.  I appreciate it. But don't worry. I  do love her. And she loves me. You  had that right all along.
Nick reaches across him, releases the brake. Puts the car into "Drive." Turns to Ashley:
Sweetness! Let's light up the tree!
Ashley steps toward the ramp, taking out a matchbook. Nic steps further into the trailer, to the back of the Nova.

Rudy immediately wriggles his hands, trying to touch his  wrists together. Trying to press together the white cuffs his Santa suit. Trying to get the right pressure point -- -- as a BLADE suddenly springs out of the cuff! The  switchblade he'd stolen from the Blazer -- it's lashed to his right wrist! Rudy starts sawing his wrist back and forth, cutting thro the Santa belt -- -- his hands at the bottom of the wheel, too low for eith Ashley or Nick to see --
Ashley is at the hood of the car, LIGHTING her match. Nic is at the back bumper, ready to push it down the ramp --
Goodbye, Rudy! Nice spending time  with you!

The belt breaks! Rudy snaps his hands free! But instead o trying to escape, he reaches under the steering column,  RIPPING its panel away and pulling wires free! As Ashley tosses her match onto the hood, and FIRE races  over the body of the car, TONGUES racing inside, over the dash, over the seats, lapping at Rudy -- -- who ducks his head beneath the wheel, frantic to locat the right leads --
Ashley jumps out of the way, to the snow. Nick pushes the flaming car to the trailer's edge -- -- starting on down the ramp, the ravine ahead -- -- and as gravity starts to take the metal bonfire --
Rudy sparks two wires together, FLAMES eating at him --
LIKE RIDING A BIKE, LIKE RIDING A  BIKE, LIKE RIDING A BIIIIIKE!
-- and the ENGINE IGNITES! Rudy slams the gearshift into "Reverse", grabs the wheel looks over his shoulder at shocked Nick behind him --
RULE ONE! NEVER PUT A CAR THIEF BEHIND  THE WHEEL!
-- and SLAMS the accelerator.

As the burning Nova races backwards up the ramp, and back into the trailer -- Terrified Nick turns to run but there's nowhere to go -- -- and the car SLAMS into the trailer's back, CRUSHING Ni legs between metal and metal!
NOOOOOOO!!!
Then Rudy faces front, pounds the shift into "Drive."
RULE TWO!

Ashley stands at the bottom of the ramp, vengeance and ra She grabs her handgun, OPENS FIRE -- -- and Rudy SLAMS the gas again, shooting down the ramp - -- as he flings open the car door, dives and rolls -- -- while the burning Nova COLLIDES with Ashley, throwing onto the hood, and sending the tandem inferno speeding of the ridgetop -- -- arcing slowly as it PLUMMETS into the ravine, a smokin blazing shooting star with a woman's figure hanging on. The shooting star hits Earth and explodes.

The same four shots that opened the film. The Santa on th floor of the cage (Pug), the Santa on the hood of the car (Merlin), the Santa in the hallway (Jumpy). And the Santa lying face-down on the snowy road. Gabriel.
The last of the opening images. Rudy's motionless Santa  figure, upside-down on the snowy incline, bits of his sui still aflame. He opens his eyes.

Rudy staggers to his feet. Battered and dazed. Looks at  Gabriel's body. Then looks to the trailer. Inside, Nick is still alive, bones broken from the waist  down. He's mumbling madly, staring at the ceiling:
...Rudy... help me... Rudy...
Rudy climbs the tire ramp. And pulls the trailer gate shu He climbs into the rig's cab. Starts the engine. Puts the truck in reverse, taps the accelerator and hops out.
...Rudy! Rudy! HELP ME!!!

The truck rolls backwards. And into the ravine. Rudy listens to its TUMBLING SOUNDS all the way to the bo He then looks up the road one way. Then the other. And notices the two money sacks sitting in the snow. He stares at them. A long time.

In his burnt and battered Santa suit, Rudy's figure trudg the snowy night. Two sacks over his shoulder. walking emp roads and highways. And passing a roadsign that reads "Si 35 Miles." He passes rural roads and driveways, and every time he co across a mailbox... he puts a stack of cash inside. On th soundtrack, the STRINGS and RUM-PUM-PUM-PUMS of "The Litt Drummer Boy" start to rise -- With snow falling, he passes a new sign: "Sidnaw -- 27 Mi With the sun rising, a PAIR OF CHILDREN huddle at a windo seeing the man in the Santa suit at the end of their driv Giving them something from his sack and ambling on. -- and we follow Rudy's march, stuffing presents into  mailboxes. At every-stop on the way.

A cul-de-sac of Norman Rockwell Michigan homes. Graced wi pines and a pristine snowfall. Christmas trees in windows lights on inside, figures of FAMILIES in holiday gear. No one noticing the man in the Santa suit, his sacks long gone, walking up the road.

At cul-de-sac's end. Where a blackened red cuff KNOCKS. After a moment, the door opens to reveal a smiling MOTHER and FATHER in their sixties. There's a party going on ins a dining table visible beyond them. The Mother and Father's smiles disappear. Shock. Concern.
Rudy...? Rudy?
Son? Is... is that you...?

The Santa Claus shuffles inside, right past them. The Santa Claus sleepwalks straight for the dining room,  finding a dozen RELATIVES, laughing and eating. A table l with turkey and stuffing, gravy and cranberry, wassail an wine. The relatives stop still. The room goes silent. The Santa Claus sits down at the head of the table. Yes, it's Rudy. Without a word, he stares at the food before him. And tak a plate. He stacks it with meat and dressing and trimming and sets it in front of him. And digs in. Stuffing his face in silence. His Mother and Father return to the dining room, gaping. other relatives look likewise. All staring at Rudy. Then, while he eats, without another sound... ...the Mother takes her seat at the table... ...and the Father pulls up another chair. They touch hands privately, and turn back to their plates There's a CLANK of silverware, a SCRAPE of china, a CLINK glass, and one-by-one, the relatives resume their meals. CONVERSATION picks up where it left off, SMILES return to the table, LAUGHTER slowly rises in the room. There is Mr. Duncan and Mrs. Duncan, Aunt Lisbeth and Unc Ray, Aunt Mary and Uncle Pete, toddler Sasha and teenage  Sam, brother Mike and his girlfriend Jill, sister Stacy a her husband Bill, Grandpa Walter, little Wendy Sue... ...and at the head of the table... Rudy Duncan. Home for Christmas. CUT TO BLACK.
